problem: A point particle with mass \( m \) and charge \( q \) moves in constant mutually perpendicular magnetic field \(\boldsymbol{B}=B_{0} \hat{z}\) and electric field \(\boldsymbol{E}=E_{0} \hat{x}\). Solve for the complete energy spectrum.
solution:
Choose a gauge such that \( \boldsymbol{A} = B_{0} x \hat{y}, \varphi = -E_{0} x \). Then,

\[
H = \frac{1}{2m}\left(\boldsymbol{P} - \frac{q}{c} \boldsymbol{A}\right)^{2} + q \varphi = \frac{1}{2m}\left[P_{x}^{2} + \left(P_{y} - \frac{q}{c} B_{0} x\right)^{2} + P_{z}^{2}\right] - q E_{0} x
\]

Since \( H \) does not contain \( y \) and \( z \), \( P_{y} \) and \( P_{z} \) commute with \( H \) and are constants, their eigenvalues can be directly substituted into the equation. Quantizing the Hamiltonian gives

\[
\begin{aligned}
H = & \frac{1}{2m} P_{x}^{2} + \frac{q^{2} B_{0}^{2}}{2m c^{2}}\left(x - \frac{c P_{y}}{q B_{0}} - \frac{m c^{2} E_{0}}{q B_{0}}\right)^{2} \\
& + \frac{1}{2m} P_{z}^{2} - \frac{m c^{2} E_{0}^{2}}{2 B_{0}} - \frac{c P_{y} E_{0}}{B_{0}} \\
= & \frac{1}{2m} P_{\xi}^{2} + \frac{m}{2} \omega^{2} \xi^{2} + \frac{1}{2m} P_{z}^{2} - \frac{m c^{2} E_{0}^{2}}{2 B_{0}} - \frac{c P_{y} E_{0}}{B_{0}}
\end{aligned}
\]

where \( P_{\xi} = P_{x}, \xi = \left(x - \frac{c P_{y}}{q B_{0}} - \frac{m c^{2} E_{0}}{q B_{0}}\right) \) are a new pair of conjugate variables, \( \omega = \frac{q B_{0}}{m c} \). Comparing the expression for \( H \) with that of a one-dimensional harmonic oscillator, we find the eigenvalues of \( H \) to be

\[
E_{n} = \left(n + \frac{1}{2}\right) \hbar \omega + \frac{1}{2m} P_{z}^{2} - \frac{m c^{2} E_{0}^{2}}{2 B_{0}} - \frac{c P_{y} E_{0}}{B_{0}}
\]

Since it involves \( P_{x} \) and \( P_{y} \), the degeneracy is infinite.
answers: \boxed{E_{n} = \left(n + \frac{1}{2}\right) \hbar \omega + \frac{1}{2m} P_{z}^{2} - \frac{m c^{2} E_{0}^{2}}{2 B_{0}} - \frac{c P_{y} E_{0}}{B_{0}}}

problem: A system has a Hamiltonian $H$ that is time-independent, and $H$ has a non-degenerate eigenvalue $\hbar \omega$ corresponding to the eigenvector $|v\rangle$, i.e., $\hat{H}|v\rangle=\hbar \omega|v\rangle$. An observable $A$ is defined in the same Hilbert space, with a similar non-degenerate eigenvalue equation $\hat{A}|n\rangle=a_{n}|n\rangle$. If the measured value is $a_{m}$, and after time $t$, the measurement is repeated, what is the probability of measuring $a_{m}$ again?
solution:
Subsequently, the system is no longer in the initial state $|v\rangle$, but in the state $|m\rangle$, which further evolves according to the Schrödinger equation:

\begin{equation*}
\mathrm{i} \hbar \frac{\partial}{\partial t}|t\rangle=\hat{H}|t\rangle
\end{equation*}

With the initial state of evolution as $|m\rangle$, the solution to equation (1) is

$$
|t\rangle=\mathrm{e}^{-\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} \hat{H} t}|m\rangle=\sum_{\mu} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{\mu} t}|\mu\rangle\langle\mu | m \rangle
$$

At time $t$, the probability of measuring $a_{m}$ again is

$$
P_{m}^{\prime}=|\langle m | t \rangle|^2 = \left|\sum_{\mu} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{\mu} t}\langle \mu | m \rangle \right|^2
$$

On the other hand,

When calculating the expectation in the state $\left|j, m_{j}\right\rangle$, only the first parenthesis in the above expression contributes

problem:
设有处于边界面附近的一个自由电子。如果 $\phi_{k}(x)$ 是电子的本征函数，证明

$$
u(x, t) = \sum_{k} \phi_{k}^{*}(x) \phi_{k}(0) \exp \left(-\frac{\varepsilon_{k} t}{\hbar}\right)
$$

是某个扩散方程的解。确定相应的扩散系数。
solution:
$\phi_{k}(x)$ 满足自由粒子的 Schrödinger 方程

$$
-\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 m} \nabla^{2} \phi_{k}(x) = \varepsilon_{k} \phi_{k}(x)
$$

所以

$$
\nabla^{2} u(x, t) = -\frac{2 m}{\hbar^{2}} \sum_{k} \varepsilon_{k} \phi_{k}^{*}(x) \phi_{k}(0) \exp \left(-\frac{\varepsilon_{k} t}{\hbar}\right)
$$

而

$$
\frac{\partial}{\partial t} u(x, t) = -\frac{1}{\hbar} \sum_{k} \varepsilon_{k} \phi_{k}^{*}(x) \phi_{k}(0) \exp \left(-\frac{\varepsilon_{k} t}{\hbar}\right)
$$

所以 $u(x, t)$ 满足扩散方程

$$
\frac{\partial}{\partial t} u(x, t) = \frac{\hbar}{2 m} \nabla^{2} u(x, t)
$$

扩散系数为 $\frac{\hbar}{2 m}$ 。

problem:
质量为 $\mu$ 的粒子在一维势场  

\[  
V(x) = -\alpha \delta(x) + V^{\prime}, \quad V^{\prime}= \begin{cases}  
0, & x<0 \\  
V_{0}, & x>0\end{cases}  
\]  

中运动，其中 $\alpha$ 与 $V_{0}$ 均为实数。试给出存在束缚态的条件，并给出其能量本征值和相应的本征函数。
solution:
在此势场中的束缚定态能量 $E<0$ ，令  

\[  
E = -|E|, \quad \beta = \sqrt{\frac{2 \mu |E|}{\hbar^{2}}}, \quad \gamma = \sqrt{\frac{2 \mu (V_{0} + |E|)}{\hbar^{2}}} \tag{1}  
\]  

不包括 $x=0$ 点的定态方程为  

\[  
\begin{array}{ll}  
\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} \psi(x)}{\mathrm{d} x^{2}} = \beta^{2} \psi(x), & x<0 \\  
\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2} \psi(x)}{\mathrm{d} x^{2}} = \gamma^{2} \psi(x), & x>0 \tag{2}  
\end{array}  
\]  

$\psi(x)$ 满足的条件  

\[  
\begin{align*}  
& \psi\left(0^{+}\right) = \psi\left(0^{-}\right), \quad \psi( \pm \infty) = 0  \tag{3} \\  
& \psi^{\prime}\left(0^{+}\right) - \psi^{\prime}\left(0^{-}\right) = -\frac{2 \mu \alpha}{\hbar^{2}} \psi(0) \tag{4}  
\end{align*}  
\]  

方程（2）满足条件(3)的解为  

\[  
\psi(x) = \left\{  
\begin{array}{lr}  
A \mathrm{e}^{\beta x}, & x<0  \tag{5}\\  
A \mathrm{e}^{-\gamma x}, & x>0  
\end{array}\right.  
\]  

将式(5)代入式(4)中得  

\[  
\gamma + \beta = \frac{2 \mu \alpha}{\hbar^{2}}  
\]  

或者  

\[  
\sqrt{\frac{2 \mu (V_{0} + E)}{\hbar^{2}}} = \frac{2 \mu \alpha}{\hbar^{2}} - \sqrt{\frac{2 \mu |E|}{\hbar^{2}}} \tag{6}  
\]  

式(6)两边平方, 得  

\[  
\sqrt{\frac{2 \mu |E|}{\hbar^{2}}} = \frac{1}{2 \alpha}\left(\frac{2 \mu \alpha^{2}}{\hbar^{2}} - V_{0}\right) \tag{7}  
\]  

显然 $|E|$ 有解的条件是  

\[  
\frac{2 \mu \alpha^{2}}{\hbar^{2}} > V_{0} \text{, 即 } \alpha^{2} > \frac{\hbar^{2} V_{0}}{2 \mu}  
\]  

这正是存在束缚态的条件. 由式(7)得  

\[  
|E| = \frac{\hbar^{2}}{8 \mu \alpha^{2}} \left(\frac{2 \mu \alpha^{2}}{\hbar^{2}} - V_{0}\right)^{2} \tag{8}  
\]  

即  

\[  
E = -\frac{\hbar^{2}}{8 \mu \alpha^{2}} \left(\frac{2 \mu \alpha^{2}}{\hbar^{2}} - V_{0}\right)^{2}  
\]  

相应的波函数如式(5)所得，其中 $\beta$ 与 $\gamma$ 是由式(1)与式(8)决定的已知量. 常数 $A$ 由归一化条件确定为  

\[  
A = \left(\frac{2 \beta \gamma}{\beta + \gamma}\right)^{1 / 2}  
\]

正负电子湮灭时，放出的能量主要来自于两者的静质量

$$

$$

释放出的角动量的大小取决于湮灭前电子偶素所处的状态。在基态，轨道角动量为 0，没有贡献，所以对 $S=0$ 的态来说，释放的角动量为 0，即没有角动量放出。对 $S=\hbar$ 的那些态来说，释放出的角动量大小为 $\Delta J=\sqrt{1+1} \hbar=\sqrt{2} \hbar$。

下面来证明终态至少有两个光子。假设电子偶素湮灭后只放出一个光子，则过程的能量和动量不可能守恒。道理是这样的：光子只要有能量 $E$ ，就一定同时带有大小为 $E / c$ 的动量。于是光子在任何一个参考系中动量不为 0，而在电子偶素的静止参考系中，过程前后动量都应为 0，因此可以断定终态至少有两个光子。

problem: When a charged oscillator is in its ground state, a uniform electric field is suddenly applied. Find the probability that the oscillator transitions to any excited state \(\psi_{k}\left(x-x_{0}\right)\) due to this perturbation.
solution:
After applying a uniform electric field \(E\), the potential energy of the oscillator with charge \(e\) becomes

\[
V(x)=\frac{1}{2} m \omega^{2} x^{2}+e E x=\frac{m \omega^{2}}{2}\left(x-x_{0}\right)^{2}+A
\]

where \(x_{0}=e E / m \omega^{2}, A\) is a constant.

Since the potential energy remains that of an oscillator (only the equilibrium position shifts to \(x_{0}\)), the stationary wave function of the oscillator after perturbation is \(\psi_{k}\left(x-x_{0}\right)\), given by

\[
\psi_{k}\left(x-x_{0}\right)=\left(\frac{m \omega}{\pi \hbar}\right)^{1 / 4} \frac{1}{\sqrt{2^{n} n!}} \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{m \omega}{2 \hbar}\left(x-x_{0}\right)^{2}} H_{n}\left(\left(x-x_{0}\right) \sqrt{\frac{m \omega}{\hbar}}\right)
\]

Assume the initial wave function is the ground state wave function of the unperturbed oscillator \(\psi_{0}(x)\), which is

\[
\psi_{0}(x)=\left(\frac{m \omega}{\hbar \pi}\right)^{1 / 4} \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{m \omega}{2 \hbar} x^{2}}
\]

At this time, the probability \(P_{k 0}\) of transitioning to the state \(\psi_{k}\left(x-x_{0}\right)\) is

\[
P_{k 0} =\left|\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \psi_{k}^{*}\left(x-x_{0}\right) \psi_{0}(x) \mathrm{d} x\right|^{2}
= \left|\frac{(-1)^{k}}{\sqrt{2^{k} \pi k!}} \mathrm{e}^{-\xi_{0}^{2} / 2} \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \mathrm{e}^{-\xi \xi_{0}} \frac{\mathrm{~d}^{k}}{\mathrm{~d} \xi^{k}} \mathrm{e}^{-\xi^{2}+2 \xi \xi_{0}} \mathrm{~d} \xi\right|^{2}
\]

where \(\xi=x \sqrt{m \omega / \hbar}, \xi_{0}=x_{0} \sqrt{m \omega / \hbar}\), and consider that

\[
H_{n}(\xi)=(-1)^{n} \mathrm{e}^{\xi^{2}} \frac{\mathrm{~d}^{n}\left(\mathrm{e}^{-\xi^{2}}\right)}{\mathrm{d} \xi^{n}}
\]

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: 一束单一能量 $E$ 的非相对论中子打到一个厚度为 $t$ 的平板平面上。在这平板中，中子在一吸引的均匀势场中运动，且 $V$ 势是排斥势，且 $V=E$，有多少中子被反射（令 $t$ 是有限的）？
solution:
解法一：当 $x<0$ 时波函数还是（1）中的形式。在 $0<x<t$ 时，Schrödinger 方程为

\[
-\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 m} \nabla^{2} \psi=0
\]

若 $\psi$ 取这样的形式： $\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{y} \cdot y} \cdot \mathrm{e}^{k x}$，有

\[
-k^{\prime 2}+k^{2}=0, \quad k= \pm k^{\prime}
\]

所以 $0<x<t$ 的波函数为

\[
\psi_{2}(x, y)=\left(a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} x}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} x}\right) \mathrm{e}^{i k_{y} \cdot y}
\]

总起来有

\[
\begin{array}{ll}
x<0, & \psi_{1}(x)=\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} x}+r \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} k_{x} x} \\
0<x<t, & \psi_{2}(x)=a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} x}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} x} \\
x>t, & \psi_{3}(x)=c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} x}
\end{array}
\]

其中

\[
k_{x}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \cos \theta, \quad k^{\prime}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \sin \theta
\]

这里只写 $x$ 分量。$y$ 分量均为 $\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{y} \cdot y}$

\[
k_{y}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \sin \theta
\]

所有边界条件为

\[
\begin{gathered}
\left\{\begin{array}{l}
1+r=a+b \\
\mathrm{i} k_{x}(1-r)=k^{\prime}(a-b) \\
c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} t}=a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} t}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}
\end{array}\right. \\
\mathrm{i} k_{x} \cdot c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} t}=k^{\prime} a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} t}-k^{\prime} b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}
\end{gathered}
\]

解得

\[
\begin{gathered}
r=\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}-1}{1-\beta^{2} \mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}}, \quad \beta=\frac{k^{\prime}-\mathrm{i} k_{x}}{k^{\prime}+\mathrm{i} k_{x}} \\
|R|^{2}=|r|^{2}=\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{gathered}
\]

解法二：用无限个振幅叠加的办法可以求解此题，这与光学中 Fabry-Perot 干涉仪的情况类似。

只考虑 $x$ 分量，以 $T_{12}, R_{12}$ 分别表示波从介质1到介质2的振幅透射及反射系数。$T_{21}, R_{21}$ 表示波从介质2到介质1的振幅透射及反射系数。设入射波振幅为1，穿过介质2出来的波振幅

\[
\begin{aligned}
T & =T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot T_{21}+T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot R_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta} R_{21} \cdot T_{21}+T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot\left(R_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta} R_{21}\right)^{2} \cdot T_{21}+\cdots \\
& =T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} T_{21}\left[1+R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}+\left(R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}\right)^{2}+\cdots\right]=T_{12} T_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \frac{1}{1-R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}}
\end{aligned}
\]

其中 $\mathrm{e}^{-\delta}$ 是波在介质2中从一界面到另一界面的衰减系数

\[
\delta=k^{\prime} t, \quad k^{\prime}=\sqrt{2 m E\left(1-\cos ^{2} \theta\right)} / \hbar=\sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\]

可以利用（1）的结果

\[
R_{12}=\left(k_{1 x}-k_{2 x}\right) /\left(k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}\right), \quad T_{12}=1+R_{12}=2 k_{1} /\left(k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}\right)
\]

但其中

\[
\begin{aligned}
& k_{1 x}=\sqrt{2 m E} \cos \theta / \hbar \\
& k_{2 x}=\mathrm{i} k^{\prime}=\mathrm{i} \sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\end{aligned}
\]

于是

\[
\begin{aligned}
& T_{12}=\frac{2 k_{1 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{2 \cos \theta}{\cos \theta+\mathrm{i} \sin \theta}=2 \cos \theta \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \theta} \\
& T_{21}=\frac{2 k_{2 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{2 \sin \theta}{\cos \theta+\mathrm{i} \sin \theta}=2 \mathrm{i} \sin \theta \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

\[
R_{21}=\frac{k_{2 x}-k_{1 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{\mathrm{i} \sin \theta-\cos \theta}{\mathrm{i} \sin \theta+\cos \theta}=\mathrm{e}^{-2 \mathrm{i} \theta}
\]

所以

\[
\begin{aligned}
T & =T_{12} T_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \frac{1}{1-R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}} \\
& =\frac{4 \mathrm{i} \cos \theta \sin \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 i \theta} \cdot \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}}{1-\mathrm{e}^{-4 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}} \\
& =\frac{2 \mathrm{i} \sin 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}}{1-\mathrm{e}^{-4 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}
\end{aligned}
\]

透射率

\[
\begin{aligned}
|T|^{2} & =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}{\left(1-\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \cos 4 \theta\right)^{2}+\left(\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \sin 4 \theta\right)^{2}} \\
& =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}{1+\mathrm{e}^{-4 k^{\prime} t}-2 \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \cos 4 \theta} \\
& =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

反射率

\[
\begin{aligned}
1-|T|^{2} & =1-\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta} \\
& =\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

其中

\[
k^{\prime}=\sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\]

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem:
一维谐振子阱中有 $N$ 个 ($N$ 是个大数) 无自旋 Fermi 子，两两之间有一排斥的 $\delta$ 函数势

$$
V=\frac{k}{2} \sum_{i=1}^{N} x_{i}^{2}+\frac{\lambda}{2} \sum_{i \neq j} \delta\left(x_{i}-x_{j}\right), \quad k, \lambda>0
$$

用归一化的谐振子单粒波函数 $\psi_{n}(x)$ 表示出三个最低能量的归一化波函数和能量。这些能级的简并度是多少？
solution:
将 $\delta$ 函数势当作微扰。零级体系波函数可用 Slater 波函数写出

$$
\psi_{n_1\cdots n_N}\left(x_{1}, \cdots, x_{N}\right) =\frac{1}{\sqrt{N!}} \left\lvert\, \begin{array}{cccc}
\psi_{n_1}\left(x_{1}\right) & \psi_{n_1}\left(x_{2}\right) & \cdots & \psi_{n_1}\left(x_{N}\right) \\
\psi_{n_2}\left(x_{1}\right) & \psi_{n_2}\left(x_{2}\right) & \cdots & \psi_{n_2}\left(x_{N}\right) \\
\vdots & \vdots & \ddots & \vdots \\
\psi_{n_N}\left(x_{1}\right) & \psi_{n_N}\left(x_{2}\right) & \cdots & \psi_{n_N}\left(x_{N}\right)
\end{array} \right\rvert
$$

由于波函数对 $x_{i}, x_{j}(i \neq j)$ 的反称性，可算出 $\delta$ 函数势的矩阵元皆为零。对零级体系无影响。能级为

$$
E_{(n_1\cdots n_N)}=\left\langle n_{1} \cdots n_{N}\right| H\left|n_{1} \cdots n_{N}\right\rangle=\hbar \omega\left(\frac{N}{2}+\sum_{i=1}^{N} n_{i}\right)
$$

式中，$\omega=\sqrt{k / m}, n_{1} \cdots n_{N}$ 两两皆不相等。

(i) 基态：
$n_{1}, \cdots, n_{N}$ 按顺序排列为 $0,1, \cdots, N-1$

$$
E_{0,1, \cdots, N-1}=\hbar \omega\left[\frac{N}{2}+\frac{N(N-1)}{2}\right]=\frac{\hbar \omega}{2} N^{2}
$$

波函数为

$$
\psi_{0,1, \cdots, N-1}\left(x_{1}, \cdots, x_{N}\right)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{N!}} \sum_{P} \delta_{P} P\left[\psi_{0}\left(x_{1}\right) \cdots \psi_{N-1}\left(x_{N}\right)\right]
$$

(ii) 第一激发态：
$n_{1}, \cdots, n_{N}$ 的顺序排列为 $0,1, \cdots, N-2, N$

$$
E_{0,1, \cdots, N-2, N}=\frac{1}{2} \hbar \omega\left(N^{2}+2\right)
$$

波函数为

$$
\psi_{0,1, \cdots, N-2, N}\left(x_{1}, \cdots, x_{N}\right)=\frac{1}{\sqrt{N!}} \sum_{P} \delta_{P} P\left[\psi_{0}\left(x_{1}\right) \cdots \psi_{N-2}\left(x_{N-1}\right) \psi_{N}\left(x_{N}\right)\right]
$$

(iii) 第二激发态：
$n_{1}, \cdots, n_{N}$ 的排列顺序有两种

$$
\{0,1, \cdots, N-2, N+1 \} \quad \text{和} \quad \{0,1, \cdots, N-3, N-1, N \}
$$

能级为

$$
E_{0,1, \cdots, N-2, N+1}=E_{0,1, \cdots, N-3, N-1, N}=\frac{\hbar \omega}{2}\left(N^{2}+4\right)
$$

波函数有两个

$$
\begin{align*}
\psi_{0,1, \cdots, N-2, N+1}\left(x_{1}, \cdots, x_{N}\right) &=\frac{1}{\sqrt{N!}} \sum_{P} \delta_{P} P\left[\psi_{0}\left(x_{1}\right) \cdots \psi_{N-2}\left(x_{N-1}\right) \psi_{N+1}\left(x_{N}\right)\right], \\
\psi_{0,1, \cdots, N-3, N-1, N}\left(x_{1}, \cdots, x_{N}\right) &=\frac{1}{\sqrt{N!}} \sum_{P} \delta_{P} P\left[\psi_{0}\left(x_{1}\right) \cdots \psi_{N-3}\left(x_{N-2}\right) \psi_{N-1}\left(x_{N-1}\right) \psi_{N}\left(x_{N}\right)\right]
\end{align*}
$$

同时，我们立刻可看出基态，第一激发态是非简并的，而第二激发态为二重简并的。

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem:
At \( t=0 \), a particle in the potential \( V(x)=\frac{1}{2} m \omega^{2} x^{2} \) is described by the wave function

\[ 
\psi(x, 0)=A \sum_{n}\left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\right)^{n} \psi_{n}(x)
\]

where \( \psi_{n}(x) \) are the energy eigenstates with energy

\[ 
E_{n}=\left(n + \frac{1}{2}\right) \hbar \omega
\]

and \(\left(\psi_{n}, \psi_{n^{\prime}}\right) = \delta_{n n^{\prime}}\). Find the expected value of energy at \( t=0 \).
solution:
\[
\bar{H}=(\psi(x, 0), \hat{H} \psi(x, 0))=\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{2^{n+1}}\left(n+\frac{1}{2}\right) \hbar \omega
\]

Note that

\[
\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{1}{x^{n}}=\frac{x}{x-1}
\]

Thus,

\[
\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{-n}{x^{n+1}}=\frac{-1}{(x-1)^{2}}
\]

Therefore,

\[
\sum_{n=0}^{\infty} \frac{n}{2^{n+1}}=1
\]

Substituting into \(\bar{H}\),

\[
\bar{H}=\frac{3}{2} \hbar \omega
\]

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem:
求在势场 $V(x)=V_{0}\left(\frac{a}{x}-\frac{x}{a}\right)^{2}(a>0)$ 中运动的粒子的渐进波函数行为。
要找出当 $x \rightarrow \infty$ 和 $x \rightarrow 0$ 时的渐进解。
solution:
为了求解这个方程，首先求在 $x \rightarrow \infty$ 时的渐进行为，当 $x \rightarrow \infty$ 时，方程 (1) 简化为

\begin{equation*}
-\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 m} \cdot \frac{\mathrm{~d}^{2}}{\mathrm{~d} x^{2}} \psi+\frac{V_{0}}{a^{2}} x^{2} \psi=0 \tag{2}
\end{equation*}

引入新的变量 $\xi=\frac{\sqrt{2 m V_{0}}}{a \hbar} x^{2}$，则方程 (2) 变为

$$
\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}}{\mathrm{~d} \xi^{2}} \psi(\xi)-\frac{1}{4} \psi(\xi)=0
$$

其解为 $\psi \sim \mathrm{e}^{\pm \xi / 2}$，但当 $x \rightarrow \infty$ 时， $\mathrm{e}^{\xi / 2} \rightarrow \infty$，舍去，有

\begin{equation*}
\psi \xrightarrow{x \rightarrow \infty} \mathrm{e}^{-\xi / 2} \tag{3}
\end{equation*}

当 $x \rightarrow 0$ 时, 方程 (1) 简化为

$$
-\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 m} \cdot \frac{\mathrm{~d}^{2}}{\mathrm{~d} x^{2}} \psi+\frac{V_{0} a^{2}}{x^{2}} \psi=0
$$

由变系数的二阶常微分方程的判定方程

$$
s(s-1)+s a_{-1}+b_{-2}=0
$$

（这里, $a_{-1}=0, b_{-2}=-\frac{2 m V_{0} a^{2}}{\hbar^{2}}$），解得

$$
s=\frac{1}{2}\left[1 \pm \left(1+\frac{8 m V_{0} a^{2}}{\hbar^{2}}\right)^{1 / 2}\right]
$$

于是

$$
\psi \xrightarrow{x \rightarrow 0} x^{\frac{1}{2}\left[1 \pm \left(1+8 m V_{0} a^{2} / \hbar^{2}\right)^{1 / 2}\right]}
$$

其中 $u(x)$ 可在 $x=0$ 处展开成 $x$ 的幂级数。但当 $x \rightarrow 0$ 时

$$
\psi(x) \sim x^{\frac{1}{2}\left[1-\left(1+8 m V_{0} a^{2} / \hbar^{2}\right)^{1 / 2}\right]} u(x) 
$$

不满足波函数的有限性，故只取

$$
\psi(x) \sim x^{\frac{1}{2}\left[1+\left(1+8 m V_{0} a^{2} / \hbar^{2}\right)^{1 / 2}\right]} u(x)
$$

problem:
考虑频率为 $\omega_{0}$ 的一维谐振子。用 $n$ 标记能量本征值，$n$ 最低从 0 开始。在初始的谐振子势上加上一个与时间无关的微扰哈密顿量：$H^{\prime} = V(x)$。用非微扰本征态表示下 $V(x)$ 的矩阵元代替给出微扰 $V(x)$ 的形式。除非 $m$ 和 $n$ 是偶数，否则 $H^{\prime}$ 的矩阵元为 0。给出这个矩阵的一部分如下，其中 $\varepsilon$ 是一个小的无量纲常数（注意在这个矩阵中指标是 $n = 0 \sim 4$）。

$$
\varepsilon \hbar \omega_{0} \begin{pmatrix}
1 & 0 & -\sqrt{1 / 2} & 0 & \sqrt{3 / 8} \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
-\sqrt{1 / 2} & 0 & 1 / 2 & 0 & -\sqrt{3 / 16} \\
0 & 0 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
\sqrt{3 / 8} & 0 & -\sqrt{3 / 16} & 0 & 3 / 8
\end{pmatrix}
$$

对于前五个能级，精确到一级微扰，求新能级。

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: Consider an electron confined to one-dimensional motion under the potential energy \( V(x) = \frac{1}{2} k x^{2} \), which is also subjected to a perturbing electric field \( \boldsymbol{F} = F \hat{\boldsymbol{x}} \). The dipole moment of the system in state \(|n\rangle\) is defined as \( P_{n} = -e\langle x\rangle_{n} \), where \(\langle x\rangle_{n}\) is the expectation value of \(x\) in state \(|n\rangle\). Find the dipole moment of the system when the electric field is present.
solution:
According to the calculation of the expectation value,

\[
\langle x\rangle_{n} = \left\langle x^{\prime} + \frac{q F}{k} \right\rangle = \left\langle x^{\prime} \right\rangle + \frac{q F}{k} = \frac{q F}{k} 
\]

Thus, the dipole moment is

\[
\boldsymbol{P}_{n} = -e \frac{q \boldsymbol{F}}{k} = e^{2} \frac{\boldsymbol{F}}{k}, \quad q = -e
\]

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: The Hamiltonian for a two-dimensional isotropic harmonic oscillator is given by \( H = \omega(N_1 + N_2 + 1) \), where \( N_i = a_i^{\dagger} a_i \), \(\left[a_i, a_j^{\dagger}\right] = \delta_{ij}\), and \(\left[a_i, a_j\right] = 0\). Calculate the commutation relations between \( H, J_1, J_2, J_3 \). Here, \( J_1 = \frac{1}{2}(a_2^{\dagger} a_1 + a_1^{\dagger} a_2) \), \( J_2 = \frac{i}{2}(a_2^{\dagger} a_1 - a_1^{\dagger} a_2) \), and \( J_3 = \frac{1}{2}(a_1^{\dagger} a_1 - a_2^{\dagger} a_2) \).
solution:
(1) The given system is a Bose system with two single-particle states. \( a_i^{\dagger} \) and \( a_i \) are the particle creation and annihilation operators, respectively. Since only \(\left[a_i, a_i^{\dagger}\right]\) is non-zero, using the commutation relation:

$$
[a b, c d] = a[b, c] d + a c[b, d] + [a, c] b d + c[a, d] b
$$

we can easily write:

$$
\begin{aligned}
& [a_1^{\dagger} a_1, a_1^{\dagger} a_1] = [a_2^{\dagger} a_2, a_2^{\dagger} a_2] = [a_1^{\dagger} a_1, a_2^{\dagger} a_2] = 0 \\
& [a_1^{\dagger} a_1, a_2^{\dagger} a_1] = -[a_2^{\dagger} a_2, a_2^{\dagger} a_1] = -a_2^{\dagger} a_1 \\
& [a_1^{\dagger} a_1, a_1^{\dagger} a_2] = -[a_2^{\dagger} a_2, a_1^{\dagger} a_2] = a_1^{\dagger} a_2 \\
& [a_2^{\dagger} a_1, a_1^{\dagger} a_2] = a_2^{\dagger} a_2 - a_1^{\dagger} a_1
\end{aligned}
$$

Thus,

$$
\begin{aligned}
& [H, J_1] = [H, J_2] = [H, J_3] = 0 \\
& [J_1, J_2] = i J_3, \quad [J_2, J_3] = i J_1, \quad [J_3, J_1] = i J_2
\end{aligned}
$$

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem:
如果 $\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle$ 是电荷算符 $Q$ 的相应于本征值 $q$ 的本征态中的任意一个，即

$$
Q\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle = q\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle
$$

"电荷共轭" 算符 $c$ 作用到 $\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle$ 上使之成为 $Q$ 的、本征值为 $-q$ 的本征态

$$
c\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle = \left|\psi_{-q}\right\rangle
$$

求算符 $c Q + Q c$ 的本征值。
solution:
设 $|\psi\rangle = \sum_{q} c_{q}\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle$，则

$$
(c Q + Q c)\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle = cQ\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle + Qc\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle = c(q\left|\psi_{q}\right\rangle) + Q\left|\psi_{-q}\right\rangle
$$

$$
= q\left|\psi_{-q}\right\rangle - q\left|\psi_{-q}\right\rangle = 0
$$

所以本征值为 0。

solution:
作 $N$ 次重复的实验，测得结果为 $\left|\psi^{+}\right\rangle$ 的平均次数为

$$
\bar{n} = N \cos ^{2} \frac{\Delta T n}{2 \hbar}
$$

均方根为

$$
\Delta n = \sqrt{N \cos ^{2} \frac{\Delta T n}{2 \hbar} \sin ^{2} \frac{\Delta T n}{2 \hbar}}
$$
answers: \boxed{\bar{n} = N \cos ^{2} \frac{\Delta T n}{2 \hbar}, \Delta n = \sqrt{N \cos ^{2} \frac{\Delta T n}{2 \hbar} \sin ^{2} \frac{\Delta T n}{2 \hbar}}}

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: 设静止参考系为 $X$，运动介质为 $X'$，$X'$ 相对于 $X$ 运动的速率为 $V$。求光在 $X'$ 中的传播速率 $u$。
solution:
按洛仑兹变换，在 $X'$ 参考系中，坐标和时间为：

$$
x' = \frac{x - V t}{\sqrt{1 - \frac{V^2}{c^2}}}, \quad t' = \frac{t - \left( \frac{V}{c^2} \right) x}{\sqrt{1 - \frac{V^2}{c^2}}}
$$

对两式微分得：

$$
\mathrm{d}x' = \frac{\mathrm{d}x - V \mathrm{d}t}{\sqrt{1 - \frac{V^2}{c^2}}}, \quad \mathrm{d}t' = \frac{\mathrm{d}t - \frac{V}{c^2} \mathrm{d}x}{\sqrt{1 - \frac{V^2}{c^2}}}
$$

两式相除得光在 $X'$ 中的传播速度：

$$
u = \frac{\mathrm{d}x'}{\mathrm{d}t'} = \frac{\mathrm{d}x - V \mathrm{d}t}{\mathrm{d}t - \frac{V}{c^2} \mathrm{d}x} = \frac{\frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t} - V}{1 - \frac{V}{c^2} \frac{\mathrm{d}x}{\mathrm{d}t}}
$$

式中，$\left(1 - \frac{1}{n^2}\right)$ 被称为菲涅耳曳引系数（也称漂移系数或拖动系数）。菲佐（1851年）、迈克耳孙和莫雷（1886年），以及塞曼（1914年）等人先后都曾用干涉法验证了菲涅耳公式。有兴趣的读者可进一步参阅，比如，R • 瑞斯尼克著、上海师范大学物理系译的《相对论和早期量子论中的基本概念》，兰斯别尔格著、杨葭荪、张之勰译的《光学》（下册），母国光和战元龄编、沈寿春校的《光学》。

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: Consider the following quantum ensemble $S_4$ with a large number of particles $N \gg 1$, consisting of particles in the state $\sin (\theta / 2)|0\rangle+\cos (\theta / 2) \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \phi}|1\rangle$, where $\theta$ and $\phi$ are random variables with constant distribution. subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: 对于 $1 \mathrm{~s}, 2 \mathrm{~s}$ 组态，计算两个在中心场中运动的电子，其中电子间的静电作用 $\frac{e^{2}}{\left|r_{1}-r_{2}\right|}$ 当作微扰，求一阶能移。将答案用非微扰量和 $\frac{e^{2}}{\left|\boldsymbol{r}_{1}-\boldsymbol{r}_{2}\right|}$ 的矩阵元表示。
solution:
两个电子的零级波函数有如下两种形式：

\[
\begin{aligned}
\phi_{+}\left(r_{1}, r_{2}\right) \chi_{00}\left(s_{1 z}, s_{2 z}\right) \\
\phi_{-}\left(r_{1}, r_{2}\right) \chi_{1 M_{s}}\left(s_{1 z}, s_{2 z}\right)
\end{aligned}
\]

式中：

\[
\phi_{\varepsilon}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}\left[u_{1 \mathrm{~s}}(1) v_{2 \mathrm{~s}}(2)+\varepsilon u_{1 \mathrm{~s}}(2) v_{2 \mathrm{~s}}(1)\right], \quad \varepsilon= \pm 1
\]

分别表示归一化的对称与反对称波函数. $\chi_{0}$ 和 $\chi_{1}$ 分别表示自旋单态与三重态. 将 $u_{1s}$ 简记成 $1, v_{2s}$ 态记为 $2$ . $\phi_{\varepsilon}$ 态记为：

\[
\left|\phi_{\varepsilon}\right\rangle = \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}(|1,2\rangle + \varepsilon |2,1\rangle)
\]

由于微扰 Hamilton 与自旋无关， $\chi$ 可不考虑。

\[
\begin{aligned}
\Delta E_{\varepsilon} & = \int \mathrm{d}^{3} r_{1} \mathrm{~d}^{3} r_{2} \phi_{\varepsilon}^{*} \frac{e^{2}}{\left|r_{1}-r_{2}\right|} \phi_{\varepsilon} \\
& = \frac{1}{2}(\langle 1,2|+\varepsilon \langle 2,1|) \frac{e^{2}}{\left|r_{1}-r_{2}\right|} (|1,2\rangle+\varepsilon |2,1\rangle) \\
& = \frac{1}{2}[\langle 1,2| A |1,2\rangle + \langle 2,1| A |2,1\rangle + \varepsilon \langle 1,2| A |2,1\rangle + \varepsilon \langle 2,1| A |1,2\rangle]
\end{aligned}
\]

式中：

\[
A = \frac{e^{2}}{\left|r_{1}-r_{2}\right|}
\]
\[
\Delta E_{\varepsilon} = K + \varepsilon J
\]

式中：

\[
\begin{aligned}
& K = \langle 1,2| A| 1,2\rangle = \langle 2,1| A |2,1\rangle \text{ 为直接积分 } \\
& J = \langle 1,2| A |2,1\rangle = \langle 2,1| A |1,2\rangle \text{ 为交换积分 }
\end{aligned}
\]

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: 考虑一个量子系统，该系统在时间 $T$ 间隔内会发生退相干，导致密度算符的非对角项 $|0\rangle\langle 1|$ 和 $|1\rangle\langle 0|$ 衰减一个因子 $e^{-\gamma T}$。假设我们进行 $\Delta$ 测量，并且需要计算该测量中的误差。请计算该系统在这个情况下的误差。
solution:
用密度矩阵表示同时有退相干情况下系统量子态

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \rho(T)=\frac{1}{2}\left(|0\rangle\langle 0|+|1\rangle\langle 1|+e^{-\mathrm{i} \frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}} e^{-\gamma T}|0\rangle\langle 1|+e^{\mathrm{i} \frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}} e^{-\gamma T}|1\rangle\langle 0|\right) \\
& P=\frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}(\langle 0|+\langle 1|) \rho(T) \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}(|0\rangle+|1\rangle)=\frac{1}{2}\left[1+e^{-\gamma T} \cos \left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right)\right]
\end{aligned}
$$

由二项式分布，可得

$$
P_{n}=C_{N}^{n}\left\{\frac{1}{2}\left[1+e^{-\gamma T} \cos \left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right)\right]\right\}^{n}\left\{\frac{1}{2}\left[1-e^{-\gamma T} \cos \left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right)\right]\right\}^{N-n}
$$

且有

$$
\bar{n}=\frac{N}{2}\left[1+e^{-\gamma T} \cos \left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right)\right], \quad \Delta n=\sqrt{N p(1-p)}=\sqrt{\frac{N}{4}\left[1-e^{-2 \gamma T} \cos ^{2}\left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right)\right]}
$$

由 $\delta \bar{n}=\Delta n$, 可得

$$
\frac{N}{2} e^{-\gamma T} \sin \left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right) \frac{T}{\hbar} \delta \Delta=\sqrt{\frac{N}{4}\left[1-e^{-2 \gamma T} \cos ^{2}\left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right)\right]}
$$

即有

$$
\delta \Delta=\frac{\sqrt{1-e^{-2 \gamma T} \cos ^{2}\left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right)}}{\sqrt{N} e^{-\gamma T} \sin \left(\frac{\Delta T}{\hbar}\right) \frac{T}{\hbar}}
$$

problem: 工作频率为 $\omega$（信号"载频"）的雷达向着相对于雷达在任意方向上以速度 $v$ 运动的物体照射。考虑多普勒效应，求物体在 $K^{\prime}$ 系坐标系中由于多普勒效应的辐射频率 $\omega^{\prime}$。
solution:
用 $K$、$K^{\prime}$ 表示坐标系，雷达在 $K$ 中静止，物体在 $K^{\prime}$ 中静止。选择 $x$ 和 $x^{\prime}$ 轴彼此平行，也平行于在 $K$ 中物体的速度方向（如图所示）。雷达的辐射照到物体上并被反射，在 $K^{\prime}$ 中由于多普勒效应其辐射频率为

\omega^{\prime} = \omega \frac{1-\beta \cos \varphi}{\sqrt{1-\beta^{2}}} \tag{1}
\]

其中 $\beta = \frac{v}{c}$, $\varphi$ 是 $K$ 中 $x$ 轴与指向物体的方向之间的夹角。

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: 设有由质量为 $M$ 的相同的两个原子组成的双原子分子，两原子相距为 $D$。分子是电极化的且绕通过质心垂直于两原子联线的轴转动。确定转动分子电偶极辐射的频率对 $J$ 的依赖关系。（把答案表示为 $J, M, D$ 和其他必须引入的普适常数的函数）
solution:
$J$ 到 $J-1$ 能级间的跃迁

$$
\hbar \omega=\Delta E=\frac{1}{M D^{2}} J(J+1) \hbar^{2}-\frac{1}{M D^{2}}(J-1) J \hbar^{2}=\frac{2 J \hbar^{2}}{M D^{2}}
$$

所以

$$
\omega=\frac{2 J \hbar}{M D^{2}}
$$

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: Based on the calculation results of the moment of inertia of the HCl molecule, estimate the distance $R$ between the two nuclei in the HCl molecule.
solution:
It is known that $I = \mu R^2, \quad \mu^{-1} = m_{\mathrm{H}}^{-1} + m_{\mathrm{Cl}}^{-1}, R$ is the distance between the two nuclei.

Therefore,

$$
\begin{aligned}
R & = \left[\frac{\left(m_{\mathrm{H}} + m_{\mathrm{Cl}}\right) I}{m_{\mathrm{H}} \cdot m_{\mathrm{Cl}}}\right]^{1/2} \\
& = \left[\frac{(1 + 35)}{1 \times 35 \times 1.66 \times 10^{-27}} \times 2.72 \times 10^{-48}\right]^{1/2} \\
& = 1.30 \times 10^{-10}(\mathrm{m}) = 1.30(\mathrm{\AA})
\end{aligned}
$$

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: 一束单一能量 $E$ 的非相对论中子打到一个厚度为 $t$ 的平板平面上。在这平板中，中子在一吸引的均匀势场中运动，且 $V$ 势是排斥势，且 $V=E$，有多少中子被反射（令 $t$ 是有限的）？
solution:
解法一：当 $x<0$ 时波函数还是（1）中的形式。在 $0<x<t$ 时，Schrödinger 方程为

\[
-\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 m} \nabla^{2} \psi=0
\]

若 $\psi$ 取这样的形式： $\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{y} \cdot y} \cdot \mathrm{e}^{k x}$，有

\[
-k^{\prime 2}+k^{2}=0, \quad k= \pm k^{\prime}
\]

所以 $0<x<t$ 的波函数为

\[
\psi_{2}(x, y)=\left(a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} x}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} x}\right) \mathrm{e}^{i k_{y} \cdot y}
\]

总起来有

\[
\begin{array}{ll}
x<0, & \psi_{1}(x)=\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} x}+r \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} k_{x} x} \\
0<x<t, & \psi_{2}(x)=a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} x}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} x} \\
x>t, & \psi_{3}(x)=c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} x}
\end{array}
\]

其中

\[
k_{x}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \cos \theta, \quad k^{\prime}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \sin \theta
\]

这里只写 $x$ 分量。$y$ 分量均为 $\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{y} \cdot y}$

\[
k_{y}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \sin \theta
\]

所有边界条件为

\[
\begin{gathered}
\left\{\begin{array}{l}
1+r=a+b \\
\mathrm{i} k_{x}(1-r)=k^{\prime}(a-b) \\
c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} t}=a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} t}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}
\end{array}\right. \\
\mathrm{i} k_{x} \cdot c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} t}=k^{\prime} a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} t}-k^{\prime} b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}
\end{gathered}
\]

解得

\[
\begin{gathered}
r=\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}-1}{1-\beta^{2} \mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}}, \quad \beta=\frac{k^{\prime}-\mathrm{i} k_{x}}{k^{\prime}+\mathrm{i} k_{x}} \\
|R|^{2}=|r|^{2}=\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{gathered}
\]

解法二：用无限个振幅叠加的办法可以求解此题，这与光学中 Fabry-Perot 干涉仪的情况类似。

只考虑 $x$ 分量，以 $T_{12}, R_{12}$ 分别表示波从介质1到介质2的振幅透射及反射系数。$T_{21}, R_{21}$ 表示波从介质2到介质1的振幅透射及反射系数。设入射波振幅为1，穿过介质2出来的波振幅

\[
\begin{aligned}
T & =T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot T_{21}+T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot R_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta} R_{21} \cdot T_{21}+T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot\left(R_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta} R_{21}\right)^{2} \cdot T_{21}+\cdots \\
& =T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} T_{21}\left[1+R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}+\left(R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}\right)^{2}+\cdots\right]=T_{12} T_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \frac{1}{1-R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}}
\end{aligned}
\]

其中 $\mathrm{e}^{-\delta}$ 是波在介质2中从一界面到另一界面的衰减系数

\[
\delta=k^{\prime} t, \quad k^{\prime}=\sqrt{2 m E\left(1-\cos ^{2} \theta\right)} / \hbar=\sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\]

可以利用（1）的结果

\[
R_{12}=\left(k_{1 x}-k_{2 x}\right) /\left(k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}\right), \quad T_{12}=1+R_{12}=2 k_{1} /\left(k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}\right)
\]

但其中

\[
\begin{aligned}
& k_{1 x}=\sqrt{2 m E} \cos \theta / \hbar \\
& k_{2 x}=\mathrm{i} k^{\prime}=\mathrm{i} \sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\end{aligned}
\]

于是

\[
\begin{aligned}
& T_{12}=\frac{2 k_{1 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{2 \cos \theta}{\cos \theta+\mathrm{i} \sin \theta}=2 \cos \theta \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \theta} \\
& T_{21}=\frac{2 k_{2 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{2 \sin \theta}{\cos \theta+\mathrm{i} \sin \theta}=2 \mathrm{i} \sin \theta \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

\[
R_{21}=\frac{k_{2 x}-k_{1 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{\mathrm{i} \sin \theta-\cos \theta}{\mathrm{i} \sin \theta+\cos \theta}=\mathrm{e}^{-2 \mathrm{i} \theta}
\]

所以

\[
\begin{aligned}
T & =T_{12} T_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \frac{1}{1-R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}} \\
& =\frac{4 \mathrm{i} \cos \theta \sin \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 i \theta} \cdot \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}}{1-\mathrm{e}^{-4 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}} \\
& =\frac{2 \mathrm{i} \sin 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}}{1-\mathrm{e}^{-4 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}
\end{aligned}
\]

透射率

\[
\begin{aligned}
|T|^{2} & =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}{\left(1-\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \cos 4 \theta\right)^{2}+\left(\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \sin 4 \theta\right)^{2}} \\
& =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}{1+\mathrm{e}^{-4 k^{\prime} t}-2 \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \cos 4 \theta} \\
& =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

反射率

\[
\begin{aligned}
1-|T|^{2} & =1-\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta} \\
& =\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

其中

\[
k^{\prime}=\sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\]

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: Consider a van der Waals force model between two atoms separated by a distance $d$ which is much greater than $\sqrt{\frac{\hbar}{m \omega}}$. Each atom consists of an electron bound to a very heavy nucleus by the potential $V(r_{i}) = \frac{1}{2} m \omega^{2} r_{i}^{2}$. Determine the ground state energy and the ground state wave function including $r_{1}$ and $r_{2}$ when $\beta = 0$.
solution:
Since the nuclei are very heavy, they can be considered immobile, and the Schrödinger equation of the system (with each nucleus as the origin) is

$$
\left[-\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2m}(\nabla_{1}^{2} + \nabla_{2}^{2}) + \frac{1}{2} m \omega^{2}(r_{1}^{2} + r_{2}^{2}) + \beta \frac{x_{1} x_{2} e^{2}}{d^{3}}\right] \psi = E \psi
$$

When $\beta = 0$, the system is equivalent to two independent three-dimensional harmonic oscillators. The ground state energy and the wave function are:

$$
\begin{gathered}
E_{0}^{(0)} = 3 \hbar \omega, \\
\Psi_{0}^{(0)}(r_{1}, r_{2}) = \psi_{0}(x_{1}) \psi_{0}(y_{1}) \psi_{0}(z_{1}) \psi_{0}(x_{2}) \psi_{0}(y_{2}) \psi_{0}(z_{2}), \\
= \left(\frac{1}{\sqrt{\pi}}\right)^{3} \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{m \omega}{2 \hbar}(r_{1}^{2} + r_{2}^{2})}.
\end{gathered}
$$

problem: Calculate the de Broglie wavelength of a neutron with an energy of \(0.05 \ \text{eV}\).

\[

\]

where \(m_{n}\) is the mass of the neutron and \(E_{k}\) is its kinetic energy. This commonly used wavelength of the order of \(1 \ \text{Å}\) is very convenient in the physics of slow neutrons.

problem: 设有一个两能级原子，它具有能级差为 $E_{2}-E_{1}=\hbar \omega_{12}$ 的两个态 $|1\rangle$ 和 $|2\rangle$ 。一开始，原子处于其基态 $|1\rangle$ ，现受到电磁辐射 $\boldsymbol{E} = \boldsymbol{E}_{m}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \omega t} + \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega t}\right)$ 的作用。若 $\omega = \omega_{12}$，计算过一段时间 $t$ 后，原子处于态 $|2\rangle$ 的概率。
solution:
$$
\begin{aligned}
& H_{0}|1\rangle=E_{1}|1\rangle=\hbar \omega_{1}|1\rangle \\
& H_{0}|2\rangle=E_{2}|2\rangle=\hbar \omega_{2}|2\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

加上电磁辐射作用后， $H=H_{0}+H^{\prime}$

$$
H^{\prime}=-\mathrm{e} \cdot \boldsymbol{E}_{m}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \omega t} + \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega t}\right)
$$

求解方程 $\mathrm{i} \hbar \frac{\partial}{\partial t}|t\rangle=H|t\rangle$ ，初始条件 $|t=0\rangle=|1\rangle$。设解具有形式

$$
\begin{gathered}
|t\rangle=c_{1}(t) \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{1} t}|1\rangle+c_{2}(t) \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{2} t}|2\rangle \\
c_{1}(0)=1, \quad c_{2}(0)=0
\end{gathered}
$$

则

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathrm{i} \hbar \left(\dot{c}_{1} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{1} t}|1\rangle - \mathrm{i} c_{1} \omega_{1} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{1} t}|1\rangle + \dot{c}_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{2} t}|2\rangle - \mathrm{i} c_{2} \omega_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{2} t}|2\rangle\right) \\
& =c_{1} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{1} t} \hbar \omega_{1}|1\rangle + c_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{2} t} \hbar \omega_{2}|2\rangle + c_{1} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{1} t} H^{\prime}|1\rangle + c_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{2} t} H^{\prime}|2\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

化简得

$$
\mathrm{i} \hbar c_{1} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{1} t}|1\rangle + \mathrm{i} \hbar c_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{2} t}|2\rangle = c_{1} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{1} t} H^{\prime}|1\rangle + c_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{2} t} H^{\prime}|2\rangle
$$

用左矢 $\langle 1|$ 和 $\langle 2|$ 乘这个方程的两端，得

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathrm{i} \hbar \dot{c}_{1}=c_{1}\langle 1| H^{\prime}|1\rangle + c_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i}\left(\omega_{2}-\omega_{1}\right) t}\langle 1| H^{\prime}|2\rangle \\
& \mathrm{i} \hbar \dot{c}_{2}=c_{1} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(\omega_{2}-\omega_{1}\right) t}\langle 2| H^{\prime}|1\rangle + c_{2}\langle 2| H^{\prime}|2\rangle
\end{aligned}
$$

令 $\langle i| - \mathrm{e} \boldsymbol{x} \cdot \boldsymbol{E}_{m}|j\rangle=\hbar a_{ij}$，上式可以写成

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \mathrm{i} \hbar \dot{c}_{1}=c_{1}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \omega t} + \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega t}\right) \hbar a_{11} + c_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega_{2} t}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \omega t} + \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega t}\right) \hbar a_{12} \\
& \mathrm{i} \hbar \dot{c}_{2}=c_{1} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \omega_{21} t}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \omega t} + \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega t}\right) \hbar a_{21} + c_{2}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \omega t} + \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega t}\right) \hbar a_{22}
\end{aligned}
$$

式中，用了记号 $\omega_{21}=\omega_{2}-\omega_{1}$。\\
如果 $E_{m}$ 很小且 $\omega_{21} \sim \omega$ 时，我们可以略去上式中快速振荡的那些项，即只保留含 $\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(\omega_{21}-\omega\right) t}$ 的那些项。

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \dot{c}_{1}=-\mathrm{i} a_{12} c_{2} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(\omega-\omega_{21}\right) t} \\
& \dot{c}_{2}=-\mathrm{i} a_{21} c_{1} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(\omega_{21}-\omega\right) t}
\end{aligned}
$$

消去 $c_{1}$ ，得出关于 $c_{2}$ 的二阶微分方程

$$
\left\{\begin{array}{l}
\ddot{c}_{2}=\mathrm{i}\left(\omega_{21}-\omega\right) \dot{c}_{2}-a_{12} a_{21} c_{2}=0 \\
c_{2}(0)=0, \quad \dot{c}_{2}(0)=-\mathrm{i} a_{21} c_{1}(0)=-\mathrm{i} a_{21}
\end{array}\right.
$$

$\omega=\omega_{21}$，记 $a_{12} a_{21}=\left|a_{12}\right|^{2}=\Omega^{2}$，显然所求解为

$$
c_{2}(t)=-\mathrm{i} \frac{a_{21}}{\Omega} \sin \Omega t
$$

因此在时刻 $t$ 处于态 $|2\rangle$ 的概率为

$$
\left|c_{2}(t)\right|^{2}=\sin ^{2} \Omega t
$$

problem:
正交晶格上一个 \({ }^{2} p_{3 / 2}\) 离子附近的静电势

\[
V(r)=A x^{2}+B y^{2}-(A+B) z^{2}
\]

其中 \(A, B\) 为常数。设对于自由离子的一组波函数为

\[
\psi_{1}=R(r) Y_{11}, \quad \psi_{0}=R(r) Y_{10}, \quad \psi_{-1}=R(r) Y_{1-1}
\]

假设 \(V(r)\) 很小，基态的一阶能量修正是 \(\pm \sqrt{a^{2}+b^{2}}\)，每一个值都是两度简并的。若相对正能量修正值的本征态之一是 \(\cos \theta\left|3 / 2\right\rangle+\sin (\theta / 2)\left|-1 / 2\right\rangle\)，这里 \(\theta=\arctan (b / a)\)，求另一个本征态。
solution:
在自由离子情况下 4 个 \(M_{J}\) 态是简并的，所以基态的一阶能量修正由矩阵的本征值给出，相应的本征函数是矩阵的本征矢。若将矩阵的基矢的顺序由 \(M_{J}=3 / 2,1 / 2,-1 / 2,-3 / 2\) 改为 \(M_{J}=3 / 2,-1 / 2,-3 / 2,1 / 2\) 所得到的矩阵更易求解，这时矩阵变为

\[
\left(\begin{array}{llll}
a & b & 0 & 0 \\
b & -a & 0 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & a & b \\
0 & 0 & b & -a
\end{array}\right)
\]

变成 2 个 \(2 \times 2\) 矩阵的直和。由于 2 个 \(2 \times 2\) 矩阵相同，故它们的本征值与本征矢相同，故仍有二重简并，由第 1 个 \(2 \times 2\) 矩阵可得方程

\[
\left(\begin{array}{cc}
a & b \\
b & -a
\end{array}\right)\binom{p}{q}=\lambda\binom{p}{q}
\]

解出

\[
\lambda= \pm \sqrt{a^{2}+b^{2}}, \quad \frac{p}{q}=\frac{\lambda+a}{b}
\]

令 \(\tan \theta=b / a\), 当 \(\lambda=\sqrt{a^{2}+b^{2}}\) 时有

\[
\frac{p}{q}=\frac{\sqrt{a^{2}+b^{2}}+a}{b}=\frac{1+\cos \theta}{\sin \theta}=\frac{\cos (\theta / 2)}{\sin (\theta / 2)}
\]

由归一化条件 \(p^{2}+q^{2}=1\)，可知 \(p=\cos (\theta / 2), q=\sin (\theta / 2)\)。类似对 \(\lambda=-\sqrt{a^{2}+b^{2}}\) 时，有

\[
p=\sin (\theta / 2), \quad q=-\cos (\theta / 2)
\]

所以相对本征值 \(\lambda= \pm \sqrt{a^{2}+b^{2}}\) 的本征态分别为

\[
\begin{cases}
\cos \frac{\theta}{2}\left|\frac{3}{2}\right\rangle+\sin \frac{\theta}{2}\left|-\frac{1}{2}\right\rangle=|1\rangle \\
\sin \frac{\theta}{2}\left|\frac{3}{2}\right\rangle-\cos \frac{\theta}{2}\left|-\frac{1}{2}\right\rangle=|2\rangle
\end{cases}
\]

同理对第 2 个 \(2 \times 2\) 矩阵求解本征方程也可得到本征值 \(\lambda^{\prime}= \pm \sqrt{a^{2}+b^{2}}\)，相应的本征矢为

\[
\begin{cases}
\cos \frac{\theta}{2}\left|-\frac{3}{2}\right\rangle+\sin \frac{\theta}{2}\left|\frac{1}{2}\right\rangle=|3\rangle \\
\sin \frac{\theta}{2}\left|-\frac{3}{2}\right\rangle-\cos \frac{\theta}{2}\left|\frac{1}{2}\right\rangle=|4\rangle
\end{cases}
\]

problem: A spinless particle (with mass \(m\) and charge \(q\)) is constrained to move along a circular path of radius \(R\). There is a uniform magnetic field \(B\) directed perpendicular to the plane of the circle. Find the allowed energy levels.
solution:
The Hamiltonian in this situation is

\[
H = \frac{1}{2m} \left(\boldsymbol{P} - \frac{q}{c} A\right)^{2}, \quad A = \frac{1}{2} B r \cdot e_{\theta}
\]

The eigenvalue equation is

\[
\frac{1}{2m} \left(-i \hbar \frac{1}{R} \cdot \frac{\partial}{\partial \theta} - \frac{q}{c} \cdot \frac{1}{2} B R\right)^{2} \psi(\theta) = E \psi(\theta)
\]

The solution is \(\psi(\theta) = c e^{i n \theta}\). For \(\psi(\theta) = \psi(\theta + 2 \pi)\), we require \(n = 0, \pm 1, \pm 2, \ldots\). Substituting into the equation gives

\[
E = \frac{1}{2m} \left(\frac{n \hbar}{R} - \frac{q}{2c} B R\right)^{2}
\]

problem: 设体系处于态 $|\psi\rangle = c_{1} Y_{11} + c_{2} Y_{10}$，且满足 $\left|c_{1}\right|^{2} + \left|c_{2}\right|^{2} = 1$。这里 $Y_{lm}$ 是球谐函数。进行角动量 $L^{2}$ 的测量时，得到的可能值、相应概率分别是多少？

problem: Consider a beam of particles approximately described by a plane wave, incident from the left along the $x$-axis onto a potential $V(x) = \gamma \delta(x)$, where $\gamma > 0$, and $\delta(x)$ is the Dirac delta function. Calculate the transmission probability.
solution:
From the previous form of the wave function and boundary conditions:

$$
\begin{aligned}
& 1 + R = S \\
& \mathrm{i} k S - \mathrm{i} k (1 - R) = \frac{2 m \gamma}{\hbar^{2}} S
\end{aligned}
$$

We solve to find:

$$
S = \left(1 + \frac{\mathrm{i} m \gamma}{\hbar^{2} k}\right)^{-1}
$$

The transmission coefficient is:

$$
T = |S|^{2} = \left(1 + \frac{m^{2} \gamma^{2}}{\hbar^{4} k^{2}}\right)^{-1} = \left(1 + \frac{m \gamma^{2}}{2 E \hbar^{2}}\right)^{-1}
$$

subject: Quantum Mechanics
topic: Orbital and Spin Angular Momentum Problems
problem: What is the matrix form of $S_z(t)$ given that $B = By$?
solution:
If $B = By$, then

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{~d} t} S_{z}(t) = \frac{g e B}{2 m c} S_{x}(t) \\
& \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{~d} t} S_{x}(t) = -\frac{g e B}{2 m c} S_{z}(t)
\end{aligned}
$$

We obtain

$$
S_{z}(t) = c_{1} \cos (g \omega t) + c_{2} \sin (g \omega t)
$$

Where $\omega = \frac{e B}{2 m c}$. From the initial conditions, we have

$$
S_{z}(0) = c_{1}, \quad S_{z}^{\prime}(0) = c_{2} g \omega = g \omega S_{x}(0)
$$

Therefore,

$$
S_{z}(t) = S_{z}(0) \cos \left(\frac{g e B}{2 m c} t \right) + S_{x}(0) \sin \left(\frac{g e B}{2 m c} t \right)
$$
answers: \boxed{S_{z}(t) = S_{z}(0) \cos \left(\frac{g e B}{2 m c} t \right) + S_{x}(0) \sin \left(\frac{g e B}{2 m c} t \right)}

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: 计算电子组态 2s 2p 的 ${}^{2S+1}L_{J}$ 值，并证明每个 ${}^{2S+1}L_{J}$ 组合的态的总数等于组态的简并度。
solution:
(1) 一个 2s 电子具有 $n=2, l=0, s=\frac{1}{2}$, 具有两个态相应于 $m_{s}=\pm\frac{1}{2}$。一个 2p 电子 $n=2, l=1, s=\frac{1}{2}$ 有 6 个态它们的 $m_{l}=1,0,-1, m_{s}=\pm\frac{1}{2}$ ($n$ 与单粒子态数无关)。每一个 2s 态可能和一个 2p 态结合成一个反对称态，所以电子组态的简并度为 $2 \times 6 = 12$。

为了获得 $L, S, J$ 值，首先将轨道角动量与自旋角动量分别相加，由题意知

$$
l_{1}=0, \quad l_{2}=1, \quad s_{1}=s_{2}=\frac{1}{2}
$$

所以

$$
L=1, \quad S=1 \text{ 或 } 0
$$

由于 $L=1$ 有 3 个空间态，相应于 $M_{L}=1,0,-1$。它们中的每一个与 2 个不同的单粒子态相关，其中一个电子 $m_{l}=0$，另一个 $m_{l}=1,0,-1$。对于每一对单粒子态我们可以构造对称与反对称的空间波函数。前者与反对称的自旋波函数 $(S=0)$ 相乘，后者与对称的三重态 $(S=1)$ 相乘，所以我们有

$$
L=1, \quad S=1 \quad \text{ 和 } \quad L=1, \quad S=0
$$

一旦我们确定了反对称的 $L, S$ 组合，则对 $J$ 没有对称性的限制，由角动量理论我们有

$$
\begin{array}{lc}
L=1, & S=1, \quad J=2,1,0 \\
L=1, & S=0, \\
J=1
\end{array}
$$

用标准符号可记为

$$
{}^{3}\mathrm{P}_{2}, \quad {}^{3}\mathrm{P}_{1}, \quad {}^{3}\mathrm{P}_{0}, {}^{1}\mathrm{P}_{1}
$$

每一个 $J$ 值有 $2J+1$ 个态，相应于 $M_{J}=J, J-1, \ldots, -J$。所以总态数为 $5+3+1+3=12$，这也正是电子组态（1）的简并度。

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: A light source emits $S$ units of light energy isotropically into a unit solid angle per unit time per unit area. If the solid angle is the one subtended by a telescope observing it, receiving the solid angle $\Omega$. Determine the amount of light energy entering the telescope per second.
solution:
According to the problem, the brightness of the light source is $S$. The light flux entering the telescope is

$$
\Phi = \int S \mathrm{~d} \Sigma \mathrm{~d} \Sigma^{\prime} \frac{\cos \theta \cdot \cos \theta^{\prime}}{r^2}
$$

where $\mathrm{d} \Sigma$ is an area element on the light source, $\mathrm{d} \Sigma^{\prime}$ is an area element of the telescope lens, $r$ is the distance from the light source to the telescope, $\theta$ is the angle between the light ray and the normal to the area element of the light source, and $\theta^{\prime}$ is the angle between the light ray and the normal to the telescope surface. Assuming the telescope is directly facing the light source, we have $\theta^{\prime} = 0$, thus $\cos \theta^{\prime} = 1$.

The solid angle subtended by the light source for the telescope is

$$
\int \frac{\cos \theta}{r^2} \mathrm{~d} \Sigma = \Omega
$$

where $\Omega$ is the solid angle received by the telescope, so only the light within $\Omega$ can enter the telescope. Let $A$ be the area of the telescope. Therefore, the light flux entering the telescope is

$$
\Phi = S \Omega A
$$

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: A particle of mass $m$ is confined in a one-dimensional deep square potential well of width $l$. Calculate the matrix elements for electric dipole transitions between the first two excited states and the ground state, and explain any quantitative differences (it is not necessary to compute all the integrals).
solution:
The Einstein coefficient for the electric dipole transition is given by

$$
A_{k k^{\prime}} = \frac{4 e^2 \omega_{k^{\prime} k}^3}{3 \hbar c^3} \left| r_{k k^{\prime}} \right|^2
$$

The matrix element for the electric dipole transition from the first excited state to the ground state is

$$
\begin{aligned}
\langle x \rangle_{21} &= \int_{-l/2}^{l/2} \psi_{1}^{*}(x) x \psi_{2}(x) \, \mathrm{d}x \\
&= \frac{2}{l} \int_{-l/2}^{l/2} x \cos \frac{\pi x}{l} \sin \frac{2 \pi x}{l} \, \mathrm{d}x
\end{aligned}
$$

The matrix element for the electric dipole transition from the second excited state to the ground state is

$$
\begin{aligned}
\langle x \rangle_{31} &= \int_{-l/2}^{l/2} \psi_{1}^{*}(x) x \psi_{3}(x) \, \mathrm{d}x \\
&= \frac{2}{l} \int_{-l/2}^{l/2} x \cos \frac{\pi x}{l} \cos \frac{3 \pi x}{l} \, \mathrm{d}x
\end{aligned}
$$

The second matrix element $\langle x \rangle_{31} = 0$ because the integrand is an odd function, meaning that the second excited state will not transition to the ground state under the electric dipole interaction. However, the first excited state can transition to the ground state under the electric dipole interaction.

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem:
作为良好的近似，晶格中电子经受一个周期势场作用。Floquet 定理也是物理事实，指出任意周期势场中的能谱分离成带有“能隙”的连续的能带。为了构造一个关于这种效应的很粗略的模型（对最低能带），设想“栅栏”非常高，以致于“基态”集 \( |n\rangle (-\infty < n < +\infty) \) 是近似的本征态，这里 \( |n\rangle \) 为第 \( n \) 个阱中的基态。记每个 \( |n\rangle \) 的能量为 \( E_{0} \)，设两个相邻势阱之间的穿透振幅为 \(\varepsilon=|\varepsilon| e^{i \alpha}\)（即 \( |n-1\rangle \leftarrow |n\rangle \rightarrow |n+1\rangle \) 的概率为 \( |\varepsilon|^{2}, \varepsilon \) 很小）。计算态

\[
|\theta\rangle=\sum_{n=-\infty}^{+\infty} e^{i n \theta} |n\rangle
\]

的能量。
solution:
\[ 
\begin{aligned}
H|\theta\rangle & =E_{0} \sum_{n=-\infty}^{+\infty} e^{i n \theta} |n\rangle (1-\varepsilon-\varepsilon^{*}) +\sum_{n=-\infty}^{+\infty} E_{0} e^{i n \theta} ( \varepsilon |n+1\rangle + \varepsilon^{*} |n-1\rangle) \\
& =E_{0}(1-2|\varepsilon| \cos \alpha)|\theta\rangle+E_{0} \sum_{n=-\infty}^{+\infty}(e^{i(n-1) \theta} \varepsilon + e^{i(n+1) \theta} \varepsilon^{*})|n\rangle \\
& =E_{0}[1-2|\varepsilon| \cos \alpha+2|\varepsilon| \cos(\theta-\alpha)]|\theta\rangle
\end{aligned}
\]

于是 \( |\theta\rangle \) 的本征值即能量为

\[
E_{\theta}=E_{0}[1-2|\varepsilon|(\cos \alpha-\cos(\theta-\alpha))]=E_{0}[1-4|\varepsilon| \sin \frac{\theta}{2} \sin \left(\frac{\theta}{2}-\alpha\right)]
\]

problem: Suppose there are three normalized degenerate states $\left(\psi_{1}, \psi_{2}, \psi_{3}\right)$ belonging to an energy level $E$. These states are linearly independent but not orthogonal. Find three orthogonal normalized wave functions.
solution:
The Schmidt orthogonalization method in linear algebra can be used. Let the three orthogonal normalized wave functions be $e_{1}, e_{2}, e_{3}$. It can be proved easily that:

$$

topic: Motion of Charged Particles in Electric and Magnetic Fields
problem: (1) 一个氢原子处在 \(2p\) 态，并且是 \(L_{x}=\hbar\) 的态。在 \(t=0\) 时，在系统上加上强度为 \(|B|\) 、方向沿 \(z\) 轴的强磁场。假定电子的自旋效应可以忽略，计算 \(L_{x}\) 的期望值随时间的变化。注意在本题中，核自旋的所有效应均可忽略。
solution:
题中给出的初始条件写成明确表达式是

\[
\left.\psi(\boldsymbol{r}, t)\right|_{t=0}=R_{21}(r) \Theta(\theta, \varphi)
\]

式中, \(\Theta(\theta, \varphi)=\frac{1}{2}\left(Y_{11}+Y_{1-1}+\sqrt{2} Y_{10}\right)\) 为 \(L_{x}=\hbar\) 本征态。  
在 \(t>0\) 时, 系统加上了强度为 \(|B|\) 的, 指向 \(z\) 轴方向的强磁场, 则系统的 Hamilton 量为

\[
H=\frac{P^{2}}{2 m}+\frac{e B}{2 m_{e} c} l_{z}+\frac{e^{2} B^{2}}{8 m_{e} c^{2}}\left(x^{2}+y^{2}\right)
\]

考虑到在一般的强磁场 \(B \sim 10^{5} \mathrm{Gs}\) 下， \(B^{2}\) 项可以忽略不计，所以重写 Hamilton 量为

\[
H=\frac{p^{2}}{2 m}-\frac{e^{2}}{r}+\frac{e B}{2 m_{e} c} l_{z}
\]

Schrödinger 方程为 \(\mathrm{i} \hbar \frac{\partial \psi}{\partial t}=H \psi\) 。方程的本征态解为

\[
\left\{\begin{array}{l}
\psi_{n l m}(r, t)=R_{n l}(r) Y_{l m}(\theta, \varphi) \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} E_{n l m} t / \hbar} \\
E_{n l m}=E_{n l}+\frac{e B}{2 m_{e} c} m \hbar
\end{array}\right.
\]

于是可得方程的一般解为

\[
\psi(\boldsymbol{r}, \boldsymbol{t})=\sum_{n l m} a_{n} \psi_{n l m}(\boldsymbol{r}) \exp \left[-\mathrm{i} \frac{E_{n l m} t}{\hbar}\right]
\]

考虑到初始条件，则系统随时间变化的波函数为

\[
\psi(r, t)=R_{21}(r)\left[\frac{1}{2} Y_{11} \exp \left(-\mathrm{i} \frac{E_{211} t}{\hbar}\right)+\frac{1}{2} Y_{1-1} \exp \left(-\mathrm{i} \frac{E_{21-1} t}{\hbar}\right)+\sqrt{2} Y_{10} \exp \left(-\mathrm{i} \frac{E_{210} t}{\hbar}\right)\right]
\]

于是， \(L_{x}\) 的期望值即为 \(\langle\psi(r, t)| L_{x}|\psi(r, t)\rangle\) 。由于 \(L_{x}=\frac{1}{2}\left(L_{+}+L_{-}\right)\)，故

\[
L_{x} Y_{11}=\frac{\hbar}{\sqrt{2}} Y_{10}, \quad L_{x} Y_{1-1}=\frac{\hbar}{\sqrt{2}} Y_{10}, \quad L_{x} Y_{10}=\frac{\hbar}{\sqrt{2}}\left(Y_{11}+Y_{1-1}\right)
\]

所以

\[
L_{x}(t)=\langle\psi(r, t)| L_{x}|\psi(r, t)\rangle=\hbar \cos \frac{e B}{2 m_{e} c} t
\]

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: Express $\exp \left[\left(\begin{array}{cc}0 & a \\ -a & 0\end{array}\right)\right]$ as a $2 \times 2$ matrix; $\alpha$ is a positive constant. Please solve using the following initial conditions: $S(0)=I, \quad S^{\prime}(0)=A$.
solution:
Method 1: Let

$$
S(a) \equiv \exp \left[\left(\begin{array}{cc}
0 & a \\
-a & 0
\end{array}\right)\right]=\exp \left[a\left(\begin{array}{cc}
0 & 1 \\
-1 & 0
\end{array}\right)\right] \equiv \mathrm{e}^{a A}, \quad A \equiv\left(\begin{array}{cc}
0 & 1 \\
-1 & 0
\end{array}\right)
$$

Clearly, we have

$$
\begin{gathered}
A^{2}=\left(\begin{array}{cc}
0 & 1 \\
-1 & 0
\end{array}\right)\left(\begin{array}{cc}
0 & 1 \\
-1 & 0
\end{array}\right)=-\left(\begin{array}{cc}
1 & 0 \\
0 & 1
\end{array}\right)=-I \\
\frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d} a} S(a)=A S(a) \\
\frac{\mathrm{d}^{2}}{\mathrm{d} a^{2}} S(a)=A^{2} S(a)=-S(a)
\end{gathered}
$$

Thus,

$$
S^{\prime\prime}(a)+S(a)=0
$$

The general solution is

$$
S(a)=c_{1} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} a}+c_{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} a}
$$

With initial conditions

$$
S(0)=I, \quad S^{\prime}(0)=A
$$

we obtain

$$
\left\{\begin{array}{l} 
c _ { 1 } + c _ { 2 } = I , \\ 
c _ { 1 } - c _ { 2 } = - \mathrm { i } A 
\end{array}\right.
$$

Therefore,

$$
\left\{\begin{array}{l}
c_{1}=\frac{I-\mathrm{i} A}{2} \\
c_{2}=\frac{I+\mathrm{i} A}{2}
\end{array}\right.
$$

Thus,

$$
\begin{aligned}
S(a) & =\frac{I-\mathrm{i} A}{2} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} a}+\frac{I+\mathrm{i} A}{2} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} a}=\frac{I}{2}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} a}+\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} a}\right)+\frac{\mathrm{i} A}{2}\left(\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} a}-\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} a}\right)=I \cos a+A \sin a \\
& =\left(\begin{array}{cc}
\cos a & \sin a \\
-\sin a & \cos a
\end{array}\right)
\end{aligned}
$$

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem:
By assuming the existence of a magnetic monopole with a strength of \( g \) to symmetrize Maxwell's equations, Dirac derived a quantization condition

\[
\frac{e g}{\hbar c}=n, \quad n \text{ is an integer}
\]

where \( e \) is the electron charge, and \( g \) is the magnetic charge. Derive a similar quantization condition semiclassically by quantizing the angular momentum of the field in a "mixed dipole" system, following the Bohr-Sommerfeld quantization steps.

Hint: What is the relation of the Poynting vector to the angular momentum of this field?
solution:
As shown in Figure 11.27, the electromagnetic field distribution of the mixed dipole system in the entire space is

\[
E=e \frac{\boldsymbol{x}-\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}}{\left|\boldsymbol{x}-\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}\right|^{3}}, \quad B=g \frac{\boldsymbol{x}+\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}}{\left|\boldsymbol{x}+\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}\right|^{3}}
\]

Figure 11.27

Use cylindrical coordinates

\[
\begin{gathered}
\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}=a e_{3} \\
\boldsymbol{x}=\rho \cos \theta e_{1}+\rho \sin \theta e_{2}+z e_{3}
\end{gathered}
\]

The electromagnetic angular momentum is

\[
\boldsymbol{L}_{em}=\frac{1}{4 \pi c} \int \boldsymbol{x} \times(\boldsymbol{E} \times \boldsymbol{B}) \, \mathrm{d}^{3} \boldsymbol{x}
\]

and

\[
\boldsymbol{E} \times \boldsymbol{B}=e g \frac{\left(\boldsymbol{x}-\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}\right) \times(\boldsymbol{x}+\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2})}{\left|\boldsymbol{x}-\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}\right|^{3} \cdot\left|\boldsymbol{x}+\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}\right|^{3}}=e g \frac{\boldsymbol{x} \times \boldsymbol{r}}{\left|\boldsymbol{x}-\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}\right|^{3} \cdot\left|\boldsymbol{x}+\frac{\boldsymbol{r}}{2}\right|^{3}}
\]

Using

\[
\begin{aligned}
& \boldsymbol{x} \times(\boldsymbol{x} \times \boldsymbol{r})=(\boldsymbol{x} \cdot \boldsymbol{r}) \boldsymbol{x}-\boldsymbol{x}^{2} \boldsymbol{r} \\
& \int_{0}^{2 \pi} \cos \theta \, \mathrm{d} \theta=\int_{0}^{2 \pi} \sin \theta \, \mathrm{d} \theta=0
\end{aligned}
\]

we get

\[
\begin{aligned}
\boldsymbol{L}_{em} & =-\frac{a e g}{2 \pi c} e_{3} \int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} \mathrm{d} z \int_{0}^{2 \pi} \mathrm{d} \varphi \frac{\rho^{2}}{\left[\left(\rho^{2}+z^{2}+a^{2}\right)^{2}-4 a^{2} z^{2}\right]^{3 / 2}} \\
& =-e_{3}\left(\frac{e g}{c}\right) \int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} \mathrm{d} t \int_{0}^{\infty} \frac{s^{3} \mathrm{d} s}{\left[\left(s^{2}+t^{2}+1\right)^{2}-4 t^{2}\right]^{3 / 2}}
\end{aligned}
\]

where \( s=\rho / a, t=z / a \).

Applying

\[
\int_{-\infty}^{+\infty} \mathrm{d} t \int_{0}^{\infty} \frac{s^{3} \mathrm{~d} s}{\left[\left(s^{2}+t^{2}+1\right)^{2}-4 t^{2}\right]^{3 / 2}}=1
\]

we get

\[
\boldsymbol{L}_{em}=-\frac{e g}{c} e_{3}
\]

The quantization condition is

\[
\left|L_{\text{emz}}\right|=n \hbar=-\frac{e g}{c}, \quad n=0, \pm 1, \pm 2, \ldots
\]

Therefore,

\[
\frac{e g}{\hbar c}=n, \quad n=0, \pm 1, \pm 2, \ldots
\]

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: Find the eigenvalue spectrum of the operator $\hat{T}(a) \equiv \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} a \hat{p}}$, where $\hat{p}=\frac{\hbar}{\mathrm{i}} \cdot \frac{d}{d x}$ is the momentum operator and $a$ is a given real constant.
solution:
(1) First, find the eigenvalue spectrum of $\hat{T}(a)$. Starting from the eigenvalue equation of the operator

\[
\hat{T}(a) \psi_{\lambda}(x)=\lambda \psi_{\lambda}(x) \tag{1}
\]

Multiply both sides of equation (1) by the adjoint operator $[\hat{T}(a)]^{\dagger}=[\hat{T}(a)]^{-1}$ and integrate with respect to $\int \mathrm{d} x \, \psi_{\lambda}^{*}(x) $ to get

\[
\int \psi_{\lambda}^{*}(x)[\hat{T}(a)]^{\dagger} \hat{T}(a) \psi_{\lambda}(x) \mathrm{d} x = \int \psi_{\lambda}^{*}(x)[\hat{T}(a)]^{\dagger} \lambda \psi_{\lambda}(x) \mathrm{d} x,
\]

which simplifies to

\[
\int\left|\psi_{\lambda}(x)\right|^{2} \mathrm{~d} x = \lambda \int \psi_{\lambda}(x)\left[\hat{T}(a) \psi_{\lambda}(x)\right]^{*} \mathrm{~d} x = \lambda \lambda^{*} \int\left|\psi_{\lambda}(x)\right|^{2} \mathrm{~d} x.
\]

This leads to

\[
|\lambda|^{2}=1, \quad \text{i.e.} \, \lambda=\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \delta} \rightarrow \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} k a} \tag{2}
\]

In the above expression: $a$ is the given real constant in the operator $\hat{T}(a)$, and $k$ is the quantum number labeling the eigenvalue $\lambda$, which can take any real value within the interval $(-\infty, \infty)$. In fact, from $\hat{T}(a)=\mathrm{e}^{-\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} a \hat{p}}$, which is a function of the momentum operator $\hat{p}$, it can be directly deduced that its eigenvalue is the eigenvalue of the momentum operator $p=\hbar k$, with the eigenvalue spectrum being a continuous spectrum.

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: At time $t=0$, the state of the particle is given by $\psi(x)=A\left(\sin^2 k x+\frac{1}{2} \cos k x\right)$. Find the average momentum of the particle at this time.
solution:
This problem cannot directly use the formula for the average value of momentum for calculation:

\[
\bar{p}=\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \psi^{*}(x) \hat{p} \psi(x) \mathrm{d} x=\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \psi^{*}(x)\left(\frac{h}{\mathrm{i}} \cdot \frac{\mathrm{d}}{\mathrm{d} x}\right) \psi(x) \mathrm{d} x \tag{1}
\]

since the condition for applying equation (1) requires that the state wave function must be square-integrable, i.e., it requires:

\[
\psi(x) \xrightarrow{|x| \rightarrow \infty} 0 \tag{2}
\]

The given state in the problem obviously does not satisfy condition (2), so we cannot directly use equation (1) for calculation. This problem can be solved using the following two methods.

Method 1: Using trigonometric identities:

\[
\sin k x=\frac{1}{2 \mathrm{i}}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k x}-\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} k x}\right), \quad \cos k x=\frac{1}{2}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k x}+\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} k x}\right)
\]

We can derive:

\[
\begin{align*}
\psi(x)= & A\left(\sin^2 k x+\frac{1}{2} \cos k x\right)=\frac{A}{4}\left(\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k x}+\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} k x}-\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} 2 k x}-\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} 2 k x}+2\right) \\
= & \frac{A}{4}(2 \pi \hbar)^{1 / 2}\left[(2 \pi \hbar)^{-1 / 2} \mathrm{e}^{\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} p_{1} x}+(2 \pi \hbar)^{-1 / 2} \mathrm{e}^{\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} p_{2} x}-(2 \pi \hbar)^{-1 / 2} \mathrm{e}^{\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} p_{3} x}\right. \\
& \left.-(2 \pi \hbar)^{-1 / 2} \mathrm{e}^{\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} p_{4} x}+2(2 \pi \hbar)^{-1 / 2} \mathrm{e}^{\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} p_{5} x}\right] \tag{3}
\end{align*}
\]

Equation (3) shows that the state of the particle is essentially a superposition state formed by the linear superposition of 5 plane waves. According to the principle of superposition, the particle has 5 possible momentum values, and their respective probabilities are:

\[
\left.\begin{array}{ll}
p_{1}=\hbar k, & \omega_{1}=\left|\frac{A}{4} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{8}|A|^{2} \\
p_{2}=-\hbar k, & \omega_{2}=\left|\frac{A}{4} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{8}|A|^{2} \\
p_{3}=2 \hbar k, & \omega_{3}=\left|-\frac{A}{4} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{8}|A|^{2}  \tag{4}\\
p_{4}=-2 \hbar k, & \omega_{4}=\left|-\frac{A}{4} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{8}|A|^{2} \\
p_{5}=0, & \omega_{5}=\left|\frac{A}{2} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{2}|A|^{2}
\end{array}\right\}
\]

Hence, the average momentum of the particle is:

\[
\bar{p}=\frac{\sum_{i=1}^{5} p_{i} \omega_{i}}{\sum_{i=1}^{5} \omega_{i}}=0
\]

Moreover, from the normalization condition of the wave function, i.e., in the state $\psi(x)$, the total probability of all possible momentum values of the particle must equal 1, we have:

\[
\sum_{i=1}^{5} \omega_{i}=\pi \hbar|A|^{2}=1, \quad A=(\pi \hbar)^{-1 / 2}
\]

Method 2: Expand the given state $\psi(x)$ using Fourier expansion:

\[
\psi(x)=\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} c(p)(2 \pi \hbar)^{-1 / 2} \mathrm{e}^{\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} p x} \mathrm{~d} p \tag{5}
\]

The inverse Fourier transform of equation (5) is:

\[
c(p)=(2 \pi \hbar)^{-1 / 2} \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \psi(x) \mathrm{e}^{-\frac{\mathrm{i}}{\hbar} p x} \mathrm{~d} x \tag{6}
\]

Substituting equation (3) into equation (6), we get:

\[
\begin{aligned}
c(p)= & \frac{A}{4 \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}}\left[\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(p_{1}-p\right) \frac{x}{\hbar}} \mathrm{~d} x+\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(p_{2}-p\right) \frac{x}{\hbar}} \mathrm{~d} x-\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(p_{3}-p\right) \frac{x}{\hbar}} \mathrm{~d} x\right. \\
& \left.-\int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(p_{4}-p\right) \frac{x}{\hbar}} \mathrm{~d} x+2 \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(p_{5}-p\right) \frac{x}{\hbar}} \mathrm{~d} x\right]
\end{aligned}
\]

Using the definition of the delta function $\delta\left(p^{\prime}-p\right)=\frac{1}{2 \pi} \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i}\left(p^{\prime}-p\right) \mathrm{x}} \mathrm{d} x$, we obtain:

\[
\begin{aligned}
c(p)= & \frac{A}{4 \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}}\left[2 \pi \hbar \delta\left(p_{1}-p\right)+2 \pi \hbar \delta\left(p_{2}-p\right)-2 \pi \hbar \delta\left(p_{3}-p\right)\right. \\
& \left.-2 \pi \hbar \delta\left(p_{4}-p\right)+4 \pi \hbar \delta\left(p_{5}-p\right)\right]
\end{aligned}
\]

Based on the properties of the delta function $\delta\left(p^{\prime}-p\right)=\left\{\begin{array}{ll}\infty, & p=p^{\prime} \\ 0, & p \neq p^{\prime}\end{array}\right.$, the particle has 5 possible momentum values and their probabilities are:

\[
\left.\begin{array}{ll}
p_{1}=\hbar k, & \omega_{1}=\left|c\left(p_{1}\right)\right|^{2}=\left|\frac{A}{4} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{8}|A|^{2} \\
p_{2}=-\hbar k, & \omega_{2}=\left|c\left(p_{2}\right)\right|^{2}=\left|\frac{A}{4} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{8}|A|^{2} \\
p_{3}=2 \hbar k, & \omega_{3}=\left|c\left(p_{3}\right)\right|^{2}=\left|-\frac{A}{4} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{8}|A|^{2} \\
p_{4}=-2 \hbar k, & \omega_{4}=\left|c\left(p_{4}\right)\right|^{2}=\left|-\frac{A}{4} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{8}|A|^{2} \\
p_{5}=0, & \omega_{5}=\left|c\left(p_{5}\right)\right|^{2}=\left|\frac{A}{2} \sqrt{2 \pi \hbar}\right|^{2}=\frac{\pi \hbar}{2}|A|^{2}
\end{array}\right\}
\]

This is consistent with the results in equation (4).

problem: A hydrogen atom is in the first excited state \( (2p) \) and is located in a cavity. Find the temperature of the cavity at which the spontaneous transition probability equals the stimulated transition probability for this hydrogen atom.
solution:
The stimulated transition probability for the hydrogen atom in the cavity is given by

\[
\omega_{12} = \frac{4 \pi^{2} e^{2}}{3 \hbar^{2}} \left| r_{12} \right|^{2} \rho\left( \omega_{21} \right)
\]

The spontaneous transition probability is

\[
A_{12} = \frac{4 e^{2} \omega_{21}^{3}}{3 \hbar c^{3}} \left| r_{12} \right|^{2}
\]

To find when they are equal, we have

\[
\frac{\pi^{2}}{\hbar} \rho\left( \omega_{21} \right) = \frac{\omega_{21}^{3}}{c^{3}}
\]

Using the black body radiation formula

\[
\rho(\omega) = \frac{\hbar \omega^{3}}{\pi^{2} c^{3}} \cdot \frac{1}{\exp (\hbar \omega / k T) - 1}
\]

we obtain

\[
\begin{gathered}
\exp \left( \frac{\hbar \omega_{21}}{k T} \right) = 2 \\
T = \frac{\hbar \omega_{21}}{k \ln 2} = 1.76 \times 10^{5} \, \text{K}
\end{gathered}
\]

problem:
A spinless particle has a wave function given by

$$
\psi=K(x+y+2z) \mathrm{e}^{-ar}
$$

where $r=\sqrt{x^{2}+y^{2}+z^{2}}$ and $K, a$ are real constants. What is the probability of finding the particle within a solid angle $\mathrm{d}\Omega$ in the direction of $\theta, \phi$, where $\theta$ and $\phi$ are the usual angles in spherical coordinates?
solution:
Expressing the wave function in spherical coordinates,

$$
\psi=K r(\cos \phi \sin \theta+\sin \phi \sin \theta+2 \cos \theta) \mathrm{e}^{-ar}
$$

After normalization, we have

$$
\begin{gathered}
K^{\prime}=\sqrt{\frac{1}{8 \pi}} \\
\psi(\theta, \phi)=\sqrt{\frac{1}{8 \pi}}\left[-\frac{1}{2}(1-\mathrm{i}) \sqrt{\frac{8 \pi}{3}} Y_{11}+\frac{1}{2}(1+\mathrm{i}) \sqrt{\frac{8 \pi}{3}} Y_{1-1}+2 \sqrt{\frac{4 \pi}{3}} Y_{10}\right]
\end{gathered}
$$

The probability of finding the particle within the solid angle $\mathrm{d}\Omega$ in the direction of $\theta, \phi$ is $P($ within $\mathrm{d} \Omega$ in the direction of $\theta, \phi $ $)=\frac{1}{8 \pi}[\sin \theta(\sin \phi+\cos \phi)+2 \cos \theta]^{2} \mathrm{~d} \Omega$.

problem: Calculate $\operatorname{Tr}[(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{A})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{B})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{C})]$, where $\boldsymbol{\sigma}$ are the Pauli matrices, and $\boldsymbol{A}, \boldsymbol{B}, \boldsymbol{C}$ are operators or constant vectors that commute with $\boldsymbol{\sigma}$.
solution:
From the equation

$$
(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{A})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{B})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{C}) = (\boldsymbol{A} \cdot \boldsymbol{B})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{C}) + \mathrm{i} [\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot (\boldsymbol{A} \times \boldsymbol{B})](\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{C})
$$

we proceed to take the trace. The first term is linear in $\sigma$, so its trace is zero. Therefore,

$$
\operatorname{Tr}[(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{A})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{B})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{C})] = \mathrm{i} \operatorname{Tr}[\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot (\boldsymbol{A} \times \boldsymbol{B})](\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{C})
$$

Using the property $\operatorname{Tr}[(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{X})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{Y})] = 2 \boldsymbol{X} \cdot \boldsymbol{Y}$, we have

$$
\operatorname{Tr}[(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{A})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{B})(\boldsymbol{\sigma} \cdot \boldsymbol{C})] = 2 \mathrm{i} (\boldsymbol{A} \times \boldsymbol{B}) \cdot \boldsymbol{C} = 2 \mathrm{i} \boldsymbol{A} \cdot (\boldsymbol{B} \times \boldsymbol{C})
$$

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: The magnetic moment of a proton is $\mu$, and it is moving in a magnetic field where $B_{x}=B_{0} \cos \omega t$, $B_{y}=B_{0} \sin \omega t$, and $B_{z}$ is a constant $\left(B_{0} \ll B_{z}\right)$. At $t=0$, all protons are polarized in the $z$ direction. At time $t$, what is the probability of the proton's spin being in the $-z$ direction?
solution:
The Schrödinger equation is given by $(H=-\mu \cdot B)$

$$
\mathrm{i} \hbar \frac{\partial}{\partial t}\binom{a}{b}=-\mu\left(\begin{array}{cc}
B_{z} & B_{0} \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \omega t} \\
B_{0} \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \omega t} & -B_{z}
\end{array}\right)\binom{a}{b}
$$

Here, $a$ and $b$ are the probability amplitudes of the proton being in the spin-up $(+z)$ and spin-down (along $-z$) states, respectively. Let

$$
a=\mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \frac{\omega}{2} t} f, \quad b=\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} \frac{\omega}{2} t} g
$$

Then $f$ and $g$ satisfy the equations

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \hbar \frac{\omega}{2} f+\mathrm{i} \hbar \frac{\partial f}{\partial t}+\mu B_{z} f+\mu B_{0} g=0 \\
& \mu B_{0} f+\mathrm{i} \hbar \frac{\partial g}{\partial t}-\hbar \frac{\omega}{2} g-\mu B_{z} g=0
\end{aligned}
$$

Considering the initial condition at $t=0$, where $|f|=1, g=0$, we have

$$
\begin{aligned}
& f=-\frac{1}{\hbar \Omega}\left(\hbar \frac{\omega}{2}+\mu B_{z}\right) \sin \Omega t+\mathrm{i} \cos \Omega t \\
& g=\frac{-\mu B_{0}}{\hbar \Omega} \sin \Omega t
\end{aligned}
$$

where $\Omega=\frac{1}{\hbar} \sqrt{\left(\hbar \frac{\omega}{2}+\mu B_{z}\right)^{2}+\mu^{2} B_{0}^{2}}$. Therefore, at time $t$, the probability of the proton's spin being in the $-z$ direction is

$$
P=|b|^{2}=|g|^{2}=\left(\frac{\mu B_{0}}{\hbar \Omega}\right)^{2} \sin^{2} \Omega t
$$

problem: 一个黑色均匀小球，半径 $r = 1 \ \mathrm{mm}$，受到平行的激光束照射，激光是圆偏振光，波长 $10^{4} \ \mathrm{nm}$。球开始时处于无重力的空间实验室中静止悬浮状态。球将绕光束方向转动。求小球的角加速度。
solution:
单色圆偏振光束可视为定向运动的光束，具有能量、动量和角动量。单个光子的角动量均为 $h / 2\pi = \hbar$。黑色小球吸收光子，将光子的角动量转换成自己的角动量。

设单位时间射在小球上的光子数为 $n$，为常量。在 $\mathrm{d} t$ 时间内小球因吸收光子而获得的角动量增量为

$$

$$

小球绕中央轴的转动惯量

$$
I = \frac{2}{5} m r^{2}
$$

在 $\mathrm{d} t$ 内，小球角速度增量为

$$
\mathrm{d} \omega = \frac{\mathrm{d} L}{I}
$$

所以角加速度为

$$
\beta = \frac{\mathrm{d} \omega}{\mathrm{d} t} = \frac{n h}{2 \pi I}
$$

problem:

$$

其中 $\hat{a} \equiv \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}(\hat{x} + i\hat{p}), \quad \hat{a}^{\dagger} \equiv \frac{1}{\sqrt{2}}(\hat{x} - i\hat{p})$。某个未归一化的能量本征函数为

problem: Discuss a neutral particle whose intrinsic angular momentum is $\sqrt{s(s+1)}$, where $s=\hbar / 2$. This means it is a particle with spin $1/2$. Assume this particle has a magnetic moment $M=\gamma s$, where $\gamma$ is a constant. The quantum mechanical state of this particle can be described using spin space, with its basis vectors being the two eigenstates of $s_{z}$, $|+\rangle$ and $|-\rangle$, which represent its spin direction parallel and antiparallel to the $z$-axis, respectively $(s_{z}|+\rangle=\frac{\hbar}{2}|+\rangle, \ s_{z}|-\rangle=-\frac{\hbar}{2}|-\rangle)$. At $t=0$, the system state is $|\psi\rangle(t=0)=|+\rangle$. This particle moves along the $y$-axis, passing through a uniform magnetic field $B=B_{0} \hat{y}$ along the $y$-axis. What are the expressions for $\left\langle s_{x}\right\rangle, \left\langle s_{y}\right\rangle, \left\langle s_{z}\right\rangle$ as a function of time?
solution:
$\left\langle s_{z}\right\rangle =\left[\cos \left(\frac{1}{2} \gamma B t\right), -\sin \left(\frac{1}{2} \gamma B t\right)\right] \frac{1}{2} \hbar\begin{pmatrix} 1 & 0 \\ 0 & -1 \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} \cos \left(\frac{1}{2} \gamma B t\right) \\ -\sin \left(\frac{1}{2} \gamma B t\right) \end{pmatrix} =\frac{1}{2} \hbar \cos (\gamma B t)$

$\left\langle s_{y}\right\rangle=0$, because at $t=0$, $\left\langle s_{y}\right\rangle=0$, thus $\hat{s}_{y}$ is a conserved quantity.

$$
\begin{aligned}
\left\langle s_{x}\right\rangle & =\frac{1}{2} \hbar\left[-\sin \left(\frac{1}{2} \gamma B t\right), \cos \left(\frac{1}{2} \gamma B t\right)\right]\begin{pmatrix} 0 & 1 \\ 1 & 0 \end{pmatrix}\begin{pmatrix} \cos \left(\frac{1}{2} \gamma B t\right) \\ -\sin \left(\frac{1}{2} \gamma B t\right) \end{pmatrix}\\
& =-\frac{1}{2} \hbar \sin (\gamma B t)
\end{aligned}
$$

subject: Quantum Mechanics
problem: 一束单一能量 $E$ 的非相对论中子打到一个厚度为 $t$ 的平板平面上。在这平板中，中子在一吸引的均匀势场中运动，且 $V$ 势是排斥势，且 $V=E$，有多少中子被反射（令 $t$ 是有限的）？
solution:
解法一：当 $x<0$ 时波函数还是（1）中的形式。在 $0<x<t$ 时，Schrödinger 方程为

\[
-\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 m} \nabla^{2} \psi=0
\]

若 $\psi$ 取这样的形式： $\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{y} \cdot y} \cdot \mathrm{e}^{k x}$，有

\[
-k^{\prime 2}+k^{2}=0, \quad k= \pm k^{\prime}
\]

所以 $0<x<t$ 的波函数为

\[
\psi_{2}(x, y)=\left(a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} x}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} x}\right) \mathrm{e}^{i k_{y} \cdot y}
\]

总起来有

\[
\begin{array}{ll}
x<0, & \psi_{1}(x)=\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} x}+r \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} k_{x} x} \\
0<x<t, & \psi_{2}(x)=a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} x}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} x} \\
x>t, & \psi_{3}(x)=c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} x}
\end{array}
\]

其中

\[
k_{x}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \cos \theta, \quad k^{\prime}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \sin \theta
\]

这里只写 $x$ 分量。$y$ 分量均为 $\mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{y} \cdot y}$

\[
k_{y}=\sqrt{\frac{2 m E}{\hbar^{2}}} \sin \theta
\]

所有边界条件为

\[
\begin{gathered}
\left\{\begin{array}{l}
1+r=a+b \\
\mathrm{i} k_{x}(1-r)=k^{\prime}(a-b) \\
c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} t}=a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} t}+b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}
\end{array}\right. \\
\mathrm{i} k_{x} \cdot c \mathrm{e}^{\mathrm{i} k_{x} t}=k^{\prime} a \mathrm{e}^{k^{\prime} t}-k^{\prime} b \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}
\end{gathered}
\]

解得

\[
\begin{gathered}
r=\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}-1}{1-\beta^{2} \mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}}, \quad \beta=\frac{k^{\prime}-\mathrm{i} k_{x}}{k^{\prime}+\mathrm{i} k_{x}} \\
|R|^{2}=|r|^{2}=\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{gathered}
\]

解法二：用无限个振幅叠加的办法可以求解此题，这与光学中 Fabry-Perot 干涉仪的情况类似。

只考虑 $x$ 分量，以 $T_{12}, R_{12}$ 分别表示波从介质1到介质2的振幅透射及反射系数。$T_{21}, R_{21}$ 表示波从介质2到介质1的振幅透射及反射系数。设入射波振幅为1，穿过介质2出来的波振幅

\[
\begin{aligned}
T & =T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot T_{21}+T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot R_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta} R_{21} \cdot T_{21}+T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \cdot\left(R_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta} R_{21}\right)^{2} \cdot T_{21}+\cdots \\
& =T_{12} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} T_{21}\left[1+R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}+\left(R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}\right)^{2}+\cdots\right]=T_{12} T_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \frac{1}{1-R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}}
\end{aligned}
\]

其中 $\mathrm{e}^{-\delta}$ 是波在介质2中从一界面到另一界面的衰减系数

\[
\delta=k^{\prime} t, \quad k^{\prime}=\sqrt{2 m E\left(1-\cos ^{2} \theta\right)} / \hbar=\sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\]

可以利用（1）的结果

\[
R_{12}=\left(k_{1 x}-k_{2 x}\right) /\left(k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}\right), \quad T_{12}=1+R_{12}=2 k_{1} /\left(k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}\right)
\]

但其中

\[
\begin{aligned}
& k_{1 x}=\sqrt{2 m E} \cos \theta / \hbar \\
& k_{2 x}=\mathrm{i} k^{\prime}=\mathrm{i} \sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\end{aligned}
\]

于是

\[
\begin{aligned}
& T_{12}=\frac{2 k_{1 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{2 \cos \theta}{\cos \theta+\mathrm{i} \sin \theta}=2 \cos \theta \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \theta} \\
& T_{21}=\frac{2 k_{2 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{2 \sin \theta}{\cos \theta+\mathrm{i} \sin \theta}=2 \mathrm{i} \sin \theta \mathrm{e}^{-\mathrm{i} \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

\[
R_{21}=\frac{k_{2 x}-k_{1 x}}{k_{1 x}+k_{2 x}}=\frac{\mathrm{i} \sin \theta-\cos \theta}{\mathrm{i} \sin \theta+\cos \theta}=\mathrm{e}^{-2 \mathrm{i} \theta}
\]

所以

\[
\begin{aligned}
T & =T_{12} T_{21} \mathrm{e}^{-\delta} \frac{1}{1-R_{21}^{2} \mathrm{e}^{-2 \delta}} \\
& =\frac{4 \mathrm{i} \cos \theta \sin \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 i \theta} \cdot \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}}{1-\mathrm{e}^{-4 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}} \\
& =\frac{2 \mathrm{i} \sin 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-k^{\prime} t}}{1-\mathrm{e}^{-4 i \theta} \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}
\end{aligned}
\]

透射率

\[
\begin{aligned}
|T|^{2} & =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}{\left(1-\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \cos 4 \theta\right)^{2}+\left(\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \sin 4 \theta\right)^{2}} \\
& =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}}{1+\mathrm{e}^{-4 k^{\prime} t}-2 \mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t} \cos 4 \theta} \\
& =\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

反射率

\[
\begin{aligned}
1-|T|^{2} & =1-\frac{4 \sin ^{2} 2 \theta}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta} \\
& =\frac{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2}{\mathrm{e}^{2 k^{\prime} t}+\mathrm{e}^{-2 k^{\prime} t}-2 \cos 4 \theta}
\end{aligned}
\]

其中

\[
k^{\prime}=\sqrt{2 m E} \sin \theta / \hbar
\]

problem: The Hermitian operator $\hat{F}$ has $n$ distinct eigenvalues, $f_i$ ($i=1,2,3, \cdots, n$). The operator $\hat{p}_i$ is the projection operator onto the eigenstate $\varphi_i$ corresponding to the eigenvalue $f_i$ of $\hat{F}$. Find the form of $\hat{p}_i$.
solution:
$$
\hat{p}_i = \prod_{\substack{k=1 \\ k \neq i}}^{n} \frac{(\hat{F} - f_k)}{(f_i - f_k)}
$$

In this expression, the product $\prod_{\substack{k=1 \\ k \neq i}}^{n}$ does not include the factor where $k=i$. Let an arbitrary function be $\psi = \sum_{j} C_j \varphi_j$. It suffices to prove that $\hat{p}_i \psi = C_i \varphi_i$. In fact,

$$
\hat{p}_i \psi = \prod_{\substack{k=1 \\ k \neq i}}^{n} \frac{(\hat{F} - f_k)}{(f_i - f_k)} \cdot \sum_{j} C_j \varphi_j = \sum_{j} C_j \left[ \prod_{\substack{k=1 \\ k \neq i}}^{n} \frac{(\hat{F} - f_k)}{(f_i - f_k)} \right] \varphi_j
$$

Within the square brackets on the right side of the equation, if $j=i$, then the numerator and denominator are identical, resulting in a value of 1. If $j \neq i$, one of the $n-1$ factors in the numerator will necessarily be zero, thus

$$
\begin{aligned}
& \prod_{\substack{k=1 \\ k \neq i}}^{n} \frac{(\hat{F} - f_k)}{(f_i - f_k)} \varphi_j = \delta_{ij} \\
& \hat{p}_i \psi = C_i \varphi_i
\end{aligned}
$$

$$

$$

=-\frac{2 m \sin(q a)}{\hbar^{2} q} B a
$$

$$
